translation.en: It is now two years since the commencement of the implementation of the Free, Compulsory Basic and Post Basic Education in Kano State introduced at the dawn of Governor Abdullahi Umar Gandujes second tenure in office.
translation.pcm: E don reach two years since wen dem start di implementation of di free compulsory basic and post basic education for Kano State wey dem introduce for di beginning of Governor Abdullahi Ganduje second term in office.

translation.en: The 2020 budget, which had to be revised to capture realities that cushion the disruptions caused by the adverse effect of COVID-19 pandemic, the Gandujes administration earmarked to the education sector 30 per cent of the total revised budget.
translation.pcm: Di 2020 budget, wey dem need revise to capture di reality wey cushion du distruption wey di adverse effect of Covid 19 pandemic case, Ganduje goment wanr make sure say education sector carry 30% for di budget.

translation.en: While in the year 2021, the sum of N37.8 billion representing 25 per cent of the total budget is allocated, less than 5 per cent of last year to education to sustain and improve on the success so far achieved in the implementation of the education policy in the state.
translation.pcm: For 2021, na N37.8 billion wey represent 25% of di budget na em dem allocate, less than 5% for last year for education wey dem plan to use improve and sustain di good things wey dem don achive on di implrmentation of di education policy for di state.

translation.en: There is no gainsaying the fact that the implementation of free and compulsory basic and secondary education in the last two years for all children in the state has recorded huge success.
translation.pcm: E no be sweet tok to say di implementation of di free and compulsory basic and secondary education for di last two years for all pikin wey dey di state don record big success

translation.en: Though very expensive, considering the huge amount of money involved, Ganduje believes that there is no better time to lay a strong foundation for the future of Kano children.
translation.pcm: E dey expensive, if we chock eyes for di amount of moni wey dem dey send, Ganduje believe say na di good time be dis to build strong foundation for di future of Kano children

translation.en: This is a promise by the governor and has been fulfilled.
translation.pcm: Dis na wetin di governor promise and e don do am

translation.en: During the period under review, the state governments huge investments into the sector in the area of infrastructure, staff development and the provision of teaching
translation.pcm: For di period under review, di state goment big investment for di sector in di area of infracstucture, staff development and di provision of teaching.

translation.en: The state government has distributed instructional materials worth over N1.5 billion to primary and junior secondary schools in the 44 Local Government Areas of the state.
translation.pcm: Di state goment don distribute instructional materials wey worth N1.5 billion to primary and junior secondary schools for di 44 Local goment Area for di state.

translation.en: The administration has distributed, in the latest exercise, over N880million to Community Promotion Council (CPC) for renovation of primary schools in the 44 local governments of the state.
translation.pcm: Di administation don distribute, for di last exercise, ova N880million to Community Promotion Council (CPC) wey dey for renovation of primary schools wey dey di 44 local goment for di state.

translation.en: The governors commitment was renewed in series of similar exercise when on   Tuesday, April 13, 2021, Governor Ganduje launched the disbursement of N148 million in grants to 1,400 public high schools across the state as part of the state Education Day activities.
translation.pcm: Di goment commitment dey renewed for plenty oda things wen for Tuesday, April 13, 2021, Governor Ganduje launch di disbursement of N148 million for grant to 1,400 public schools wey dey di state as aprt of di state Education Day activities.

translation.en: The grant is also aimed at improving the states
translation.pcm: Di grant dey also to make di state dey improve

translation.en: Almajiri free education and integration policy.
translation.pcm: Free education for di Almajiri pikin and integration policy

translation.en: In fact, since assumption of office in 2015, the Ganduje administration has never failed to provide its matching funding for the development of education, even as the state has already paid part of the 2021 funding.
translation.pcm: Since dem enter office for 2015, di Ganduje administation neva fail to provide moni for di development of education, even as di state don already pay part of di 2021 funding

translation.en: The state government has also been strengthening other sources of funding for the policy that include resources from Education Trust Fund (ETF)
translation.pcm: Di state goment don dey strenghthening oda source of funding for di policy wey include resources from Education Trust Fund

translation.en: Today, in Kano, 98 percent of primary school teachers in the state are qualified.
translation.pcm: Today, for Kano, 98% of teacher wey dey primary school for di state dey qualified.

translation.en: The feat was achieved through sustainable training and re-training of primary school teachers by his administration.
translation.pcm: Na through sustainable training and re-training dey take achieve di feat for primary school teachers for hin administration

translation.en: So far, almost all primary school teachers have obtained the lowest teaching qualification, Nigerian Certificate of Education (NCE).
translation.pcm: Na almost all primary school teachers don obtain di lowest teaching qualification wey dem dey call Nigerian Certificate of Education (NCE)

translation.en: The free education policy has provided opportunities to all school-age children to gain access to quality education for a full cycle of basic education.
translation.pcm: di free education policy don provide opportunity to all school-age pikin make dem gain access to quality education for one full cycle of basic education

translation.en: Indeed, the launching of free, compulsory basic and secondary education policy has made serious impact with the reduction of the data of out-of-school children in Kano.
translation.pcm: true true, as dem launch di free, compulsory basic and secoundary education policy, e don make serious impact as di data for out-of -school for Kano don reduce

translation.en: Over 500,000 out-of-school children in the state are now back to school, as the states school enrolment level increases tremendously.
translation.pcm: Ova 5000,000 out of school pikin for di state don go back to school, as di schools wey dey di state don enrol dem well well.

translation.en: The state witnessed a drastic increase in school enrolment, following numerous intensive interventions in the education sector.
translation.pcm: Di state see big increase for school enrolment, as plenty intensive intervention don enter di education sector.

translation.en: Muhammad Garba is the commissioner for Information, Kano State.
translation.pcm: Muhammad Garba be di commissioner for Information, for Kano State.

translation.en: 6 years after, Buhari still struggling to fulfill campaign promises
translation.pcm: afta 6 years, Buhari neva see hin campaign promise do

translation.en: It is exactly six years that the Muhammadu Buhari-led All Progressives Congress (APC) administration came on board after wresting power from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), which was on the saddle of power in the country for 16 years.
translation.pcm: E don reach six years wey Muhammadu Buhari All Progressives Congress (APC) administation enter power as dem comot pipo Domocratic parti (PDP), wey dey power for di kontri for 16 years

translation.en: The feat was achieved because majority of Nigerians believed that a central government led by Buhari would fulfill all its campaign promises.
translation.pcm: Di thing apun as plenty Nierians believe say a federal goment wey Buhari go be president go do wetin dem promise

translation.en: The incumbent president focused his 2015 election campaigns on three key matters affecting the country corruption, insecurity and the need to revive the economy.
translation.pcm: Di incumbent president put hin 2015 campaigns for three major matta wey dey affect di kontri, corruption, insecurity and di need to make di economy dey good again

translation.en: Two of these three campaign promises were well captured among the eight cardinal programmes the APC manifesto pledged to offer Nigerians if voted into power in 2015.
translation.pcm: Two for di three campaign promise dey well arrange for di eight point agenda wey APC carry kom wey dem wan do for Nigerians if dem vote dem inside offive for 2015

translation.en: The programmes include war against corruption, food security, accelerated power supply, integrated transport network, free education, devolution of power, accelerated economic growth and affordable health care.
translation.pcm: Di agenda include war against corruption , food security, better power supply, better transport, free education, devoluton of power, fast and better economy and better heath care

translation.en: Despite the fact that the three campaign promises deliberately chosen by Mr President have not been fully realized, against the high expectations of Nigerians, Buhari was re-elected for a second term of four years in 2019.
translation.pcm: Even as di three campaign promise wey Mr president promise neva too show, as Nigerians think say e go be, Buhari dey re-elected for di second term wey be four years for 2019.

translation.en: He defeated another PDP candidate and former Vice President Atiku Abubakar in a keenly contested election.
translation.pcm: Na anoda PDP candidate e defeat wey be former Vice President, Atiku Abubakar for election wey dey tight.

translation.en: Buhari repeated these promises during the re-election campaign and sued for more understanding from Nigerians based on past mistakes and unforeseen circumstances that affected his first term of four years.
translation.pcm: Buhari tok diz same promise again for di re-election campaign and e beg for Nigerian understanding for di mistake wey dem do in di past and for thing wey affect hin first term for office.

translation.en: Analysts say the re-election was made possible because of support from his die-hard supporters who believe that he should be given more time, and the quest for power rotation to the southern part of the country.
translation.pcm: Analysts tok say di re-election dey possible bikos hin die hard supporters wey believe say make dem give am more time, and power rotation to di southern part of di kontri.

translation.en: But six years down the line, the three key electoral promises seem not to have been redeemed.
translation.pcm: As six years don pass, di three promise wey Buhari tok neva dey show

translation.en: The Buhari government has underperformed Dr Kari
translation.pcm: Buhari goment no perform well, na em Dr. Kari tok

translation.en: When contacted, a political analyst, Dr Abubakar Kari, while assessing the current government based on its main campaign promises, said the Buhari administration had underperformed in the three key areas of the economy, fight against corruption and tackling insecurity.
translation.pcm: Wen we call am, a political analyst, Dr Abubakar Kari, wen hin dey tok about di current goment on wetin dey tok say dey go do for campaign, tok say Buhari administration no perform well for economy, fight against corruption and make dem fight insecurity.

translation.en: Dr Kari, who said President Buhari had performed below expectation these past six years, added that he hadnot delivered on his promises to the satisfaction of friends and foes alike in those areas he had personally chosen as his signature projects.
translation.pcm: Dr Kari, wey tok say president Buhari no do well for di past six years, tok say e neva deliver on wetin e promise to evribodi on matter wey e choose as hin signature project

translation.en: Lekki seaport to create 2,000 direct jobs  MD
translation.pcm: Lekki seaport go create 2,000 direct job

translation.en: Motorists throng fuel stations in Kaduna as NUPENG joins warning strike
translation.pcm: Pipo wey dey drive moto plenty for fuel station inside Kaduna as NUPENG join warning strike

translation.en: The country also got trapped in the cyclical global recession twice.
translation.pcm: Di kontri sef enta recession two times as recession apun all ova di world

translation.en: To cap it all, the devastating effects of the COVID-19 pandemic are still being felt.
translation.pcm: Make we ok am finish, di wahala wey Covid-19 kos, pipo still dey feel am

translation.en: But beyond that, the management of the economy has been less than convincing and has been characterised by policy inconsistencies and contradictions.
translation.pcm: Beyond wetin apun, di management of di economy no too di good bikos na inconsistent and contradicting policy full evriwhere.

translation.en: The consequence, simply put, is that on a scale, Nigerians are worse off today than they were six years ago.
translation.pcm: Di consequence, make we tok am simple be say, Nigerians no dey enjoy again at all as dem dey enjoy six years ago

translation.en: The verdict is really out on what the true situation is in regard to fighting corruption.
translation.pcm: Di verdict dey out on wetin be di true situation on di fight against corruption matter

translation.en: In the area of insecurity, even Buharis most diehard supporters are aware that Nigeria is far less secure than in 2015.
translation.pcm: For insecurity, even dem Buhari die hard fans know say Nigeria no too dey secure than 2015

translation.en: The Boko Haram insurgency has become intractable even though bombs no longer go off outside the main theater of war
translation.pcm: Dem no fit track di Boko Haram insurgency again evenif na only for battle field  bomb dey blow

translation.en: It is truly frightening and appalling and unbelievable that this could happen under Buhari!
translation.pcm: E dey frightening and unbelievable say dis kin thing fit apun under Buhari

translation.en: , the director-general (DG) of the Voice of Nigeria (VON) and a chieftain of the ruling APC from Enugu State, Mr Osita Okechukwu, scored the Buhari administration above average.
translation.pcm: Mr Osita Okechukwu wey be di director-general of Voice of Nigeria (VON) and wey be chieftain of APC wey kom from Enugu State, give Buhari administation above average score

translation.en: Okechukwu said the administration had invested and committed more human and material resources in agriculture more than any other regime in the post 1970 Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Okechukwu tok say di administation don invest and commit plenty human and material resources for agriculture pass any oda regime for di post 1970 Nigeria

translation.en: He said the process remained a precursor towards economic growth.
translation.pcm: E tok say di process be step to economic growth

translation.en: He, however, admitted that security was one of the downsides of the administration as President Buhari was equally disgusted over the general insecurity in the land.
translation.pcm: E kom admit say security worse for dis administation as Buhari sef no like as insecurity plenty all ova di land

translation.en: Okechukwu said,In reference to President Buharis regime in the last six years, without being immodest, one scores him above average.
translation.pcm: Okechukwu tok say if we look at president Buhari regime for di past six years, if person no do ojoro, hin score am above average

translation.en: However, one must not shy away from some downsides.
translation.pcm: Howeva, make we no pretend say e no get bad side

translation.en: Secondly, he has constructed more roads, railways and other physical infrastructure more than the 16 locust years of the PDP.
translation.pcm: secondly, e don construct more road, railway and oda infracstucture wey we fit see more dan di 16 years wey PDP use for power.

translation.en: These, to me, are veritable foundation for diversification of our economy and signpost to revamping our economy.
translation.pcm: Diz, to me, be foundation for how we go take diverse awa economy and make awa economy better

translation.en: The downside is palpable insecurity in the land.
translation.pcm: Di bad side be say insecurity dey di land

translation.en: Mr President, like most Nigerians, is disgusted over the general insecurity in our dear country.
translation.pcm: di insecurity wey dey awa dear kontri dey irritate Mr. President just as e dey irritate Nigerians sef

translation.en: We must accept some unforced errors of ours.
translation.pcm: We need accept some error wey we do

translation.en: However, Mr President neither generated the sharp decline of oil prices
translation.pcm: Howeva, no be Mr. President kos why oil price go down

translation.en: immediately he took office in 2015 nor the COVID-19, which dealt heavy blow to our mono-economy and worsened the security situation in Nigeria.
translation.pcm: As hin resume office for 2015 nor di covid, wey give awa economy big blow and e worsen di security situation for Nigeria

translation.en: Dr A. Babalola, a senior lecturer and the head of the Department of Economics, Al-Hikmah University, Ilorin, said,Inflation is one of the KPI.
translation.pcm: Dr A. Babalola wey be senior lecturer and di head of Department of Economics for Al-Hikmah University, Ilorin tok say inflation be one of di KPI

translation.en: Every Nigerian does not need the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) or Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) data.
translation.pcm: No be all Nigerians need di National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) or Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) data

translation.en: On security, Dr Babalola said,We do not need security threat index to tell us the level of insecurity in the country.
translation.pcm: On security matter, Dr Babalola tok say er no need security threat index to know di level wey insecurity don reach for di kontri

translation.en: Before 2015, banditry and kidnapping were quite insignificant, but as at today, even the children at homes understand the words and the so-called ransom more than their study in school.
translation.pcm: Before 2015, banditry and kidnapping dey insignificat, but today, even piken for house know wetin di word mean and wetin ransom mean more dan wetin dem dey teach dem for school

translation.en: What has caused this?
translation.pcm: Wetin kos am?

translation.en: It is because insecurity has become the talk of the country.
translation.pcm: Na bikos insecurity don turn di tok of di kontri

translation.en: Summarily, the present administration has reduced corruption and improved the economy, but it is still not significant.
translation.pcm: Di present administation don reduce corruption and dey don do di economy well but e neva dey significant

translation.en: When it comes to insecurity, much needs to be done as it is really causing lots of rumple in Nigerias economy.
translation.pcm: On insecurity matter, plenty work still dey to do as e dey kos rumple on Nigeria economy.

translation.en: Motorists in Kaduna on Sunday thronged petrol stations to fuel their vehicles as the five-day warning strike directed by the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) in Kaduna State begins.
translation.pcm: Motorist go petrol stations go fuel dia vehicle for Kaduna on Sunday as di five-days warning strike wey di Nigeria Labour Congress announce start.

translation.en: The NLC had on May 10 said it would ground all activities in the state from May 16, as it begins a warning strike over the irregular sack of civil servants by the state government.
translation.pcm: Di NLC on May 10 don tok say dem go ground all activities for di state from May 16, as dem start a warning strike ova di sack of civil servant by di goment

translation.en: The Nigeria Union of Petroleum and Natural Gas Workers (NUPENG) also directed its members to shut down services in Kaduna State from May 16.
translation.pcm: Di Nigeria Union of Petroleum and Natural Gas Workers (NUPENG) sef tell dia members say make dem shut down work for Kaduna State from May 16

translation.en: This development has forced motorists into panic buying of fuel in preparation for the five-day warning strike.
translation.pcm: Na wetin kos why motorist dey buy fuel be dis in preparation for di five days warning strike wey wan apun

translation.en: A correspondent of the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) who monitored petrol stations in some parts of the metropolis reports the presence of long queues in most of the stations visited.
translation.pcm: One tori person fo News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) wey dey watch petrol stations for some area report say long queues dey most of di station wey em visit

translation.en: Residents were also seen with containers of different sizes at different petrol stations struggling to buy the product.
translation.pcm: Residents sef carry containers go buy petrol for different petrol stations and dem dey stuggle to buy di product

translation.en: Some of the petrol stations visited were A. M. Yola Petrol Station, Katsina Road, Mobil Petrol Station, Waff Road, A. Y. M Ashafa Petrol Station, Ahmadu Bello Way, Edi- Jen Petrol Station, Ahmadu Bello Way, among others.
translation.pcm: Some of di petrol station wey dem visit na A. M. Yola Petrol Station, Katsina Road, Mobil Petrol Station, Waff Road,  A. Y. M Ashafa Petrol Station, Ahmadu Bello Way, Edi- Jen Petrol Station, Ahmadu Bello Way and plenty odas

translation.en: Mr James Audu, one of the motorists at A. M. Yola filling Station, Katsina Road, told NAN that he decided to fill his vehicle tank out of fear that filling stations may not operate from Monday.
translation.pcm: Mr James Audu, wey be one of di motorist for A. M Yolla filling station, Katsina Road, tell NAN say e decide to fill hin vehicle bikos say e dey fear say dem fit no work for Monday.

translation.en: You are aware that NLC is commencing a five-day warning strike in Kaduna state from Monday and you know how critical petrol is to our movement and survival.
translation.pcm: You dey aware say NLC go do five days warning strike for Kaduna start from Monday and you sabi say petrol dey important for awa movement and survival

translation.en: I am here to fill my vehicle tank and a 25 litre container for my generator at home to ensure power supply during the strike days as electricity supply had already been suspended, he said.
translation.pcm: I dey here to fill my tank and 25 liter keg wey I go use for my generator for house to make sure say light dey for house wen dem dey do dia strike bikos say eletricity sef no go dey.

translation.en: Another motorists, Mr Ibrahim Rasheed, also said that the panic buying of the essential product was necessary to keep businesses going during the strike.
translation.pcm: Anoda motorist, Mr. Ibrahim Rasheed tok say make work no stop na e make am kom buy di petrol

translation.en: I am a fashion designer and need power to work.
translation.pcm: I be fashion designer and I need power to dey do my work

translation.en: already electricity supply has been suspended, meaning that people like us will have to resort to generator and that cannot happen without fuel, he said.
translation.pcm: light no dey, na em be say pipo like us need dey use generator and we no fit use am if petrol no dey, he tok

translation.en: The Station Manager, Mr Rayyanu Ahmad, told NAN that they are selling the product because he was yet to receive official directive from the union to suspend services.
translation.pcm: Mr, Rayyanu Ahmad wey be Station Manger, tell NAN say dem dey sell di product bikos say e neva hear anything from em ogas at di top

translation.en: This is said to have been a major reason Ibrahim Magu was sacked as the acting boss of the EFCC after a presidential probe on alleged diversion of recovered loot and replaced with a substantive chairman, Abdurasheed Bawa.
translation.pcm: Na wetin dem tok say na why Ibrahim Magu get sacked as di acting EFCC boss afta dem probe on alledge diversion of recovered loot and dem replace am wit Abdulrasheed Bawa

translation.en: On the pursuit of economic growth, the target has been hindered by the drop in the price of crude oil, recessions and the COVID-19 pandemic in the midst of skyrocketing increase in the prices of commodities.
translation.pcm: As dem dey pursuit economic growth, na di drop in crude oil price dey inder di target, resession and Covid-19 pandemic in di midst of skyrocketing increase for di price of commodities.

translation.en: There has been a resurgence of insurgency terrorism in the North-East, banditry and cattle rustling in the North-West and North-Central, kidnapping and farmers-herders clashes in the South-West.
translation.pcm: Resurgence of insurgency terrorist don dey apun for North-East, banditry and cattle rustling for North-West and North-Central, dem dey kidnap farmers-herders clashes in di South-West

translation.en: The economy has remained in the doldrums.
translation.pcm: Di economy don remain in di doldrum

translation.en: But to be fair to Buhari, he has been unlucky to encounter great and daunting challenges he clearly never envisaged.
translation.pcm: But make we dey fair to Buhari, e dey unlucky to face big and daunting challenges e clearly neva enviage

translation.en: At the beginning of his first term, elements from the Niger Delta embarked on willful blowing and destruction of pipelines and flow stations.
translation.pcm: At di start of hin first time, elements from di Niger Delta embarked on willful blowing and destrucion of pipeline and flow station.

translation.en: I assure you we will close down as soon as I receive directive to do so, may be later in the day.
translation.pcm: I assure you we go close once I hear anythin from my oga, e fit be later in di day

translation.en: It will be painful for everyone but we hope for a positive response from the state government at the end of the warning strike, Ahmad said.
translation.pcm: E go dey painful for evrione but we dey hope for positive response from di state goment at di end of di warning strike, Ahmed tok

translation.en: Electricity supply in the state had been suspended since 12 a.m on Sunday.
translation.pcm: Dem don take light for di state since 12:00am for Sunday

translation.en: The management of Kaduna Electric, in a statement, informed its customers that the Transmission Company of Nigeria has knocked off all its 33KV lines in the state in compliance with the NLC directive.
translation.pcm: For one statement wey di management of Kaduna Electric release, dem infirm dia customers say di Transmission Company of Nigeria don knock off al dia 33kv lines wey dey di state in comliance wit wetin NLC tell dem.

translation.en: Kogi police nab tricycle operator for robbing passenger
translation.pcm: Kogi police don catch tricyle operator wey dey rob passagers

translation.en: The Kogi State Police Command has arrested a tricycle operator, Abdulmumin Jimoh, for robbing his passenger of  two Android phones, some cash and an ATM card in the Lokoja metropolis.
translation.pcm: Di Kogo State Police Command don arrest tricycle operator, Abdulmumin Jimoh, wey rob hin passagers of two andriod phone, moni and ATM card for inside Lokoja metropolis

translation.en: Spokesman for the Kogi State Police Command, DSP Williams Ovye Aya, who disclosed this in a statement Thursday, said the suspect was arrested by operatives of Operation Puff Adder, through synergy with members of the vigilante.
translation.pcm: DSP Williamns Ovye Aya wey be toktok pesin for di Kogi State Police Command, wey tok dis for Thursday, tok say dem arrest  di suspect by operatives of Operation Puff Adder, e tok say vigilante memebers sef help dem

translation.en: He said the arrest was made following reports that the suspect together with his gang members now at large, robbed a passenger who boarded the suspects tricycle from the Dumanis Church junction, along Ganaja road to Ganaja, Lokoja metropolis.
translation.pcm: E tok say report of di bad thing wey di suspect wit hin gang don na em kos why dem go arrest dem, dem rob a passager wey enter di suspect tricycle from Dumani Church Junction, wey dey along Ganaja road to Ganaja, inside Lokoja metropolis

translation.en: He said it was immediately after the 200 units junction, one of the gangs who posed as a passenger covered the victims  mouth and put a knife on her neck, in which they dispossessed her of two Android phones, voters card, ATM card and a sum of N10,000 cash.
translation.pcm: E tok say na immediately afta di 200 units junction, one of di gang wey dey do like passenger na em cover di victim mouth and e put knife for her neck, and dem collect her Andriod, voters card, ATM card and N100, 000 cash.

translation.en: It was thereafter the tricycle operator now pushed her out of the Keke and ran away.
translation.pcm: Na afta dem kom push am out of di keke and dem run away

translation.en: And immediately, the victim stopped another tricycle and narrated her ordeal.
translation.pcm: Na immediately di victim stop anoda keke and she narrate her palava for dem.

translation.en: North Korea pull out of World Cup qualifiers
translation.pcm: North Korea comot for World Cup qualifiers

translation.en: North Korea have pulled out of next months qualifying matches for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar, the Asian Football Confederation said Sunday.
translation.pcm: North Korea don comot for next month qualifying match for di 2022 World Cup for Qatar, di Asian Football Confederation tok am on Sunday

translation.en: The Asian Football Confederation has today confirmed the withdrawal of the DPR Korea Football Association from the Asian Qualifiers for the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022, the AFC said in a statement.
translation.pcm: Di Asian Football Confederation confirm today di witdrawal of di DPR Korea Football Association from di Asian Qualifiers for di Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022, na di AFC tok am

translation.en: No reasons were given for the withdrawal but South Korean media reported earlier this month that Pyongyang had said it would skip the qualifiers over coronavirus fears.
translation.pcm: Dem no give any reason for why dem witdraw but South Korean media tok for early dis month say Pyongyang don tok say e go skip qualifier over corona virus fears.

translation.en: The COVID-19 pandemic has forced most of the second round of Asias preliminary tournament for the Qatar World Cup to be postponed until June.
translation.pcm: Di covid-19 pandemic don force most of di second round of Asia preliminary tournament for di Qatar World to dey postpone until June

translation.en: The AFC said last month it would change the format of the tournaments so that each group of five nations would play in one host country.
translation.pcm: Di AFC for last month tok say e go change di format of di tournament make each group of five nations go play for one host kontri

translation.en: South Korea was selected as the centralised venue host for Group H, which is led by Turkmenistan and also included the two Koreas, Lebanon and Sri Lanka.
translation.pcm: Dem don pick South Korea as di centralise venue make dem host Group H, wey Turkmenistan lead and di two korean dey dia too, Lebanon and Sri Lanka

translation.en: North Korea were fourth in Asian qualifying Group H, but only a point behind Group H leaders Turkmenistan with three games still to be played before their withdrawal.
translation.pcm: na fourth North Korea dey for Asian qualifying Group H, but na one point dem dey behind Turkenistan wey be Group H leader wit three game wey remain to play before dem witdraw.

translation.en: The AFC said a decision would be made later on the standings in Group H after referring the matter to FIFAs organising committee for competitions.
translation.pcm: AFC tok say dem go take decision later on di standings for Group H afta dem refer di matter to FIFA organising committee for competitions.

translation.en: The tournament doubles up as qualifiers for the 2023 Asian Cup, to be held in China.
translation.pcm: Di tournament double as qualifiers for di 2023 Asian Cup, wey go apun for China

translation.en: Pyongyang's decision to pull out comes nearly a month after the country said it would not go to this year Tokyo Olympics, citing concerns over the pandemic.
translation.pcm: Na almost a month afta Pyongyang tok say dem no go go dis year Tokyo Olympics afta dem tok say di reason na di pandemic na em dem decide to pull out

translation.en: North Korea was one of the first countries to close its borders more than a year ago to protect itself from the virus that first emerged in neighbouring China.
translation.pcm: North Korea  be one of di first kontri wey close em border more dan one year ago to protect emself from di virus wey first emerge for neighbouring China.

translation.en: How Kano is becoming Nigeria's rice milling hub
translation.pcm: How Kano dey bikom Nigeria rice milling hub

translation.en: With many rice mills springing up in Kano State, coupled with increase in production, the state is gradually becoming the hub of rice, not only in Nigeria but West Africa.
translation.pcm: As many rice mill dey spring up for Kano, and as production dey increase, di state don dey turn di hub for rice, no be only for Nigeria but West Africa

translation.en: The recent rice farming activities in Kano have been seen as a record-breaking achievement in the history of Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Di rice farming activities for Kano don be like record-breaking achievement for di history of Nigeria.

translation.en: The consumption of rice is said to have increased to 4.7 per cent, almost four times the global consumption growth.
translation.pcm: As pipo dey eat rice don increase to 4.7%, e don grow four times di global consumption growth

translation.en: This triggered a revolution in the sector; hence the increase in rice milling in Kano.
translation.pcm: Na wetin trigger revolution for di sector be dat, na wetin kos di increase for rice milling for Kano.

translation.en: In places like Kura, Gezawa, Bunkure, Garun Malam and Tudun Wada local government areas of the state, it is common to see a cluster of small-scale rice millers doing business.
translation.pcm: For area dem like Kura, Gezawa, Bunkure, Garun Malam and Tudun Wada local goment wey dey di state, e dey common to dey see plenty small-scale rice millers wey dey do business.

translation.en: It is the first mega rice mill owned by a woman in Kano State.
translation.pcm: Na di first mega rice mill wey woman be di owner be dis for Kano State

translation.en: This resulted in an increase in the number of rice farmers in the state as demand increased.
translation.pcm: Di result be say di number of rice farmer dem increase for di state bikos say demand don increase

translation.en: It was reported that rice milling revolution in Kano started in 2014 when 70,000 farmers were mapped out to benefit from the years dry season farming programme in the states agricultural scheme.
translation.pcm: Dem be report say rice milling revolution for Kano start for 2014 wen 70,000 farmer dem dey map out to benefit from di dry season faring programme wey dey apun for di state.

translation.en: It is also on record that as at 2019, Nigeria ranked as the first in Africa and the 14th largest producer of rice in the world, with China being the top producing country.
translation.pcm: Dem don record am say for 2019, na first in Africa Nigeria rank and 14th largest producer of rice for di world, as Chine top di kontri list.

translation.en: According to Iliyasu Nazifi, an engineer and young entrepreneur, in the last five years, rice production received the boost it had never received in the history of agriculture in Nigeria, which gave rise to the many milling factories in Kano State.
translation.pcm: Iliyasu Nazifi wey be engineer and young entrepreneur tok say rice don get di boost wey em neva get before for di last five years for di history of agriculture for Nigeria, wey allow many milling factory dem start for Kano State

translation.en: Nazifi is the chief executive officer of the Golden Star Rice Mill and a member of the Rice Processors Association of Nigeria (RIPAN).
translation.pcm: Nazifi be chief executive officer for Golden Star Rice Mill and e be member of Rice Processors Association of Nigeria (RIPAN)

translation.en: It was also said that this achievement wouldnt have been possible without the commitment and support of members and leadership of the RIFAN across all the states in Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Dem tok say di thing no go dey possible witout di commitment and support of member and leaderhip of di RIFAN wey dey different states inside Nigeria

translation.en: According to the chairman of the RIFAN in Kano State, Alhaji Abubakar Haruna, Nigerians were initially estimated to have been consuming more than five million metric tons of rice each year, with a significant portion coming from imports.
translation.pcm: Alhaji Abubakar Haruna wey be chairman of di RIFAN for Kano State tok say dem don estimate say Nigerians dey consume more than five million metric ton of rice evri year, wey most dey kom from import

translation.en: He further revealed that demand, which was growing faster than supply, driven by factors like population growth and urbanisation, actually gave birth to the strategies adopted by the government to ensure increased production, which would lead to self-sufficiency.
translation.pcm: He tok say deman d wey dey grow than supply, wey be say population growth and urbanisation be parts of factor wey dey drive am, na em give birth to di strategy wey goment adopt to make sure say production increase wey go lead to self-sufficiency.

translation.en: The development of rice value chain in Nigeria has immeasurably reduced urban-city migration and youth restiveness as many of the youths are gainfully engaged in agricultural practices, Haruna said.
translation.pcm: Di development wey don apun for rice value chain for Nigeria don reduce urban-city migration and youth restiveness as plenty youth don dey engage in agreicultural practices, na Haruna tok am

translation.en: Also, the treasurer of the RIFAN in the state, Malam Hussaini Shuaibu, revealed that the decision of the Federal Government to close Nigerias land borders against rice importation created a huge demand and created awareness for more domestic b mills.
translation.pcm: Malam Hussaini Shuaiu wey be treasurer of RIFAN for di state, tok say di decision of di Federal goment to close border against rice importation don create big demand and em don create awearness for more deomestic mills

translation.en: It was also revealed that the states rice production capacity increased; hence the establishment of mills.
translation.pcm: Dem also tok say di capacity of di state for rice production don increase, na why den fit establish mills

translation.en: Very soon, Kano State will move from being the centre of commerce to that of farming and processing, Shuaibu said.
translation.pcm: E no go tey, Kano State go move from center of commenrce to farming and processing, na wetin Shuaibu tok

translation.en: However, the Kano State Chamber of Commerce, Industries, Mines and Agriculture (KACCIMA) is worried that  the state has only recorded industrial boom in rice milling while other sectors suffer great setback.
translation.pcm: Kano State Chamber of Commerce, Industries, Mines and Agriculture (KACCIMA)  dey worry say na only for rice milling di state don record boom and oda sector dem no dey too grow

translation.en: According to the first deputy president of the KACCIMA, Ambassador Usman Darma, most industries in Kano are closed down due to electricity issues and financial challenges associated with policies of some commercial banks.
translation.pcm: According to wetin Ambassador Usman Darma wey be first deputy president of KACCIMA tok, plenty industry dem for Kano don close down bikos say electricity palava and financial challenges wey dey associated wit policy dem wey some commercial bank dey do.

translation.en: He added that only few of the industries operate in full capacity.
translation.pcm: E add say na few of di industry dey work full capacity

translation.en: 85 per cent of industries in Kano are not working.
translation.pcm: 85% of industry wey dey Kano no dey work

translation.en: The only expansion so far recorded is in rice mills, and that is because government policies have been favourable to the operators.
translation.pcm: Di expansion wey dem record na only for rice mill, and na bikos goment policy dem dey favourable to di operators

translation.en: However, with the recent visit by a combined team of the National Assembly and the Ministry of Industry, Trade and Investment, we are hopeful that the issue would be addressed in due course, he said.
translation.pcm: As combine team from National Assembly and Ministry of industry, Trade and Investment don visit, we hope say di issue go dey addredded for due course, e tok.

translation.en: Boko Haram kills two Cameroonian soldiers in Nigeria
translation.pcm: Na two cameroonian soldier dem Boko Haram send go heaven for Nigeria

translation.en: Two Cameroonian soldiers deployed to Nigeria were killed late Saturday in a Boko Haram attack in northeastern Borno state.
translation.pcm: Two Cameroonian soldiers wey dem send go Nigeria na dem dey kil for Saturday for one Boko Haram attack for northeastern Borno State.

translation.en: The insurgents, on foot and in several trucks fitted with machine guns, attacked Nigerian soldiers outside the town of Wulgo.
translation.pcm: Di insurgent, wey dey on foot and wey also dey on truck wey machine gun dey, attack Nigeria soldier dem outside Wulgo town

translation.en: Cameroonian soldiers were then also attacked after deploying from across the border to assist.
translation.pcm: Dem kil Cameroonian soldier dem too wey dem send make dem kom assist from across di border.

translation.en: Two CDF (Cameroonian Defence Force) soldiers were killed in the 40-minute gunfight with the Boko Haram terrorists, a Nigerian military source said.
translation.pcm: Na for di 0-minutes gunfight wit Boo Haram terrorist dem kil di two CDF soldier dem, na one military source tok am.

translation.en: Another three CDF soldiers and a Nigerian soldier were injured in the fight, said the military officer.
translation.pcm: Dem three Cameroonian Defence Force soldeir dem ad Nigerian soldier injure for di fight, na di military man tok am.

translation.en: An armoured vehicle belonging to the Nigerian army and two Boko Haram trucks were destroyed in the fight whileseveral jihadists wereneutralised, the second military officer said.
translation.pcm: Armour vehicle wey belong to Nigeria Army and two truck wey be say na Boko Haram dem get am na em pafuka for fight and dem neutralise pkenty jihadist dem, na wetin di second military officer tok be dat

translation.en: The jihadists launched the attack from the nearby Wulgo forest, a known Boko Haram hideout.
translation.pcm: Na for nearby Wulgo forest di jihadist launch attack, a place where we know say be hideout of Boko Haram

translation.en: The jihadist insurgency in northeast Nigeria has killed 36,000 people and displaced around two million from their homes since 2009, according to the United Nations.
translation.pcm: Di jihadist insurgency wey dey apun northeast of Nigeria don send 36,000 pipo go heaven and don displace about 2 million pipo from di place wey dem dey live since 2019, according to wetin di United Nations tok

translation.en: The violence associated with Boko Haram and its splinter group ISWAP, the Islamic State West Africa Province, has spread to neighbouring Chad, Cameroon and Niger.
translation.pcm: Di violence wey Boko Haram and dia splinter group, ISWAP, the Islamic State West Africa Province, don spread reach Chad, Cameroon and Niger

translation.en: In 2015, a regional military coalition, the Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) was tasked with fighting the insurgents.
translation.pcm: For 2015, regional military coalition, di Multinational Joint Task Force na dem dey fight di insurgency

translation.en: Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari replaced the countrys top military commanders in January in a sudden overhaul after months of pressure over deteriorating security.
translation.pcm: Muhammadu Buhari, wey be Nigeria president for january replace di kontri top military commanders and pressure ova deteriorating security don dey for months

translation.en: Suspected IPOB members attack FCID in Abia
translation.pcm: IPOB members wey dem suspect don attack FCID wey dey for Abuja

translation.en: The Nigeria Police Force Criminal Investigation Department (FCID) located at Umuagu, Umuahia in Abia State is under attack by gunmen believed to be members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB).
translation.pcm: Di Nigeria Police Force Criminal Investigation Department (FCID) wey dey Umuagu, Umuahia for Abia State dey attack by gunmen wey dem believe to be IPOB member dem

translation.en: The gunmen, numbering over 50, were half-naked.
translation.pcm: Di gunmen, wey pass 50, dey half nacked

translation.en: Some were seen hanging live cock around their neck while many of them are armed with AK47 rifles.
translation.pcm: Dem see some wey hang chicken wey dem neva kil for dia neck and many of dem carry AK47

translation.en: They attacked the security formation and set it ablaze.
translation.pcm: Dem attack di security place and throw fire inside

translation.en: A security source told our correspondent that a combined team of the military and Police engaged the hoodlums afterwards.
translation.pcm: Security source tell awa tori pipo say military and police dem join hand to fight di gunmen later

translation.en: He added that stray bullets killed some people in the process of a gun battle between them.
translation.pcm: He add say stray bullet kil some pipo for gun battle wey dey apun

translation.en: Meanwhile, soldiers have taken over Umuahia as of the time of this report.
translation.pcm: Meanwhile, soldier dem don take over Umuahia as di time wey we dey report dis tori

translation.en: It could be recalled that Umuahia residents woke up seeing men of the Nigerian Army patrolling major streets in Umuahia and manning areas believed to be flashpoints.
translation.pcm: We fit remember say pipo wey dey live for Umuahia wake up and sem see Nigerian Army wey dey patrol street for Umuahia and dem dey stay for area wey be flashpoint

translation.en: The Speaker of the Ogun State House of Assembly, Olakunle Oluomo, has faulted the Senate President, Ahmed Lawans, comment over a meeting and resolutions reached by Southern governors.
translation.pcm: Olakunle Oluomo, wey be Speaker of di Ogun State House of Assembly, don fault di Senate President, Ahmed Lawan comment ova meeting and resolution wey dem Souther Governors dem reach

translation.en: Seventeen Southern governors met last week in Asaba, Delta State, where they called for the convocation of a national dialogue, demanded bold steps to restructure the country, a total ban on open grazing and also asked President Muhammadu Buhari to address the nation.
translation.pcm: Southern Governors, wey be seventeen see last week for Asaba, Delta State, wey dem call for national dialogue, dem demand make dem restructure di kontri, make dem ban open grazing totally and dem ask President Muhammadu Buhari make e tok to di nation

translation.en: Lawan in a reaction, accused the governors ofretreating to regionalism to address a national issue that should be collectively decided upon.
translation.pcm: Lawan for how e react, tok say di governors dey reyreate to regionalism to dey address national issue wey evribodi suppose decide upon togeda

translation.en: The Ogun speaker who spoke in Abeokuta at the weekend, however, said Lawans comments were not healthy.
translation.pcm: Di Ogun Speaker dey tok for Abeokuta for weekend tok say wetin Lawan tok do dey healthy

translation.en: This is the first time in the history of the country when the governors of the Southern part of Nigeria would come out openly on this matter and align themselves with the request and demand of their people.
translation.pcm: Na dis be di first time for di history of Nigeria wey governors wey kom from di southern part of Nigeria go kom out for public on dis matter and align demsef wit wetin di pipo want.

translation.en: It shows that he has a pre-meditated mind
translation.pcm: Em show say e get pre-meditated mind

translation.en: Manchester City will be crowned Premier League champions if they beat Chelsea this afternoon in a game which is now a dress rehearsal for the Champions League final.
translation.pcm: Dem go crown Manchester City Premier League champions if dem beat Chelsea dis afternoon for game wey be dress reheasal for di champions league final

translation.en: Victory at the Etihad Stadium would allow Pep Guardiolas City side to open up an insurmountable 16-point lead over second-placed Manchester United, who have just five matches remaining.
translation.pcm: If City win for Etihad Stadium, Pep Guardiola side go open insurmountable 16 point lead ova second place Manchester United, wey get five matches remaining.

translation.en: But while the title is now a formality for City, the Chelsea game takes on extra significance after the two clubs earned their places in the May 29th Champions League final in Istanbul.
translation.pcm: As di title be formality for City, di Chelsea game dey significant afta di two clubs enta Chanpions League final for Istanbul on May 29

translation.en: German coach Thomas Tuchel has had an extraordinary impact on Chelsea since joining the club three months ago and can also look forward to an FA Cup final against Leicester City on 15 May.
translation.pcm: German coach Thomas Tuchel don make great impact for Chelsea since e join di club like three months ago and dey look forward to FA Cup final wey dem go play against Liecester City on 15 May

translation.en: The West London club reached that final by beating Manchester City in the semifinal and that result is fresh in Tuchels mind.
translation.pcm: Di West London club reach final as dem beat Manchester City for semifinal and di result dey fresh for Tuchel mind

translation.en: This doesnt give us the upper hand but it gives us a good feeling
translation.pcm: E no give us upper hand but e give us good feeling

translation.en: , it gives us self-confidence, said Tuchel, who has described City as the benchmark for his team.
translation.pcm: Tuchel tok say e give dem good confidence, e describe Manchester City as a benchmark for hin team

translation.en: We wanted to close the gap to Manchester City and in this one match in the semifinal we did in a very impressive performance, and we will need exactly the same level of performance again.
translation.pcm: We wan close di gap on Manchester City and for di match for semi final we do well and we go need di same level of performance again

translation.en: But it gave us belief, he said.
translation.pcm: But e give us believe, e tok

translation.en: Chelsea also have plenty to play for on Saturday as they look to secure a top-four finish and guarantee a place in next seasons Champions League.
translation.pcm: Chelsea get plenty thing to play for for Saturday as dem wan secure top-four finish and guarantee a place for next season Champions League.

translation.en: Tuchels side are currently in fourth place but have just a three-point advantage over fifth placed West Ham United.
translation.pcm: Na fourth place Tuchel side dey but dem get just three-point advantage ova West Ham United wey dey fifth

translation.en: On Sunday, Manchester United start a run of three games in five days, with a trip to Aston Villa.
translation.pcm: For Sunday, Manchester United start dey play three game for five days, as dem go still travel go Aston Villa.

translation.pcm: Na NDLEA organise di programme in collabo wit non-gomental organisation dem for Ilorin

translation.en: Umoru said for the first time in the last 10 years, 22 and 26 grammes of cocaine were recovered from one Sherifat Yusuf and Yusuf Abdullahi respectively.
translation.pcm: Na from one Sherifat Yusuf and Yusuf Abdullahi dem recover 22 and 26 grammes of cocain, Uoru tok say na first time inside di last 10 years be dis

translation.en: He noted that over 46 of the suspects arrested during raids who are drug users have been counseled and released.
translation.pcm: He tok say ova 46 of di suspect wey dey use drug wey dem carry durin raid don be counsel and released.

translation.en: The Commissioner of Police, Kwara State Command, Muhammed Lawal-Bagega, represented by CSP Fayola Temitope, urged parents to have interest in the activities of their children to prevent them from abusing drugs.
translation.pcm: CSP Fayola Temitope wey dey represent the Commissioner of Police, Kwara State Command, Muhammed Lawal-Bagega, urge parent dem make dem get interest for inside wetin dia children dey do to take prevent dem from drug abuse

translation.en: The coordinator of the workshop, Mr Samuel Rotimi, said the essence of the programme is to share ideas on how to reduce the cases of drug abuse to the barest minimum.
translation.pcm: Mr Samuel Rotimi wey be di coordinator of the workshop, tok say di essence of di programme na to share ideas on how dem go take reduce drug abuse case to barest minimum.

translation.en: OCP Africa and the Nigerian Institute of Soil Science (NISS) have signed a Memorandum of Understanding on management of problematic soils in Nigeria.
translation.pcm: OCP Africa and di Nigerian Institute of Soil Science (NISS) don sign Memorandum of Understanding on how dem go manage problematic soils for Nigeria.

translation.en: The OCP Africa Country Manager is Mr Caleb Usoh
translation.pcm: Mr Caleb Usoh be OCP Africa kontri Manager

translation.en: This project aligns with other numerous OCP Africa farmer-centric projects, he added.
translation.pcm: E add say di project dey align wit oda plenty OCP Africa farmer-centric project

translation.en: So, I don't understand what prompted such reaction from the senate president.
translation.pcm: I no sabi wetin prompt such reaction from di senate president.

translation.en: We may not be aware that Nigeria is one of the main target markets for universities in the United Kingdom.
translation.pcm: We fit no know say Nigeria dey one of di target market for university dem wey dey United Kingdom

translation.en: There is even some history to demonstrate how events in Nigeria could affect the survival of an institution of higher learning in the United Kingdom.
translation.pcm: History sef dey wey fit show how events for Nigeria fit affect how institutions of higer learning wey dey United Kingdom fit survive.

translation.en: Mrs. Elizabeth Ivase (1936-2019) was the first female minister in northern Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Mrs. Elizabeth Ivase (1936-2019) be di first minister wey be female for northern Nigeria

translation.en: She was minister of education in the Second Republic.
translation.pcm: Na she be di minister of education inside Second Republic

translation.en: Because of the importance of her position, the University of Wales, where she once studied, invited her to Cardiff.
translation.pcm: As her important position take be, di University of Wales, wey she don study before, be invite her kom Cardiff

translation.en: There, she pledged that every year, the Nigerian government would sponsor a significant number of Nigerians to study at the University College Cardiff (UCC) where a variety of social science and humanities courses were undertaken.
translation.pcm: Na dia she pledge say for evri year, Nigeria goment go dey sponsor Nigerians to kom study for inside University Colledge Cardiff where different social science and humanities course dem dem dey do.

translation.en: The funds they would receive from Nigerian students within a few years were so enormous that they incurred a huge debt to build and expand their facilities.
translation.pcm: Di moni wey dem go see for Nigerian student for inside few years too big and e make dem incurre huge debt take  build and expand dia facilities

translation.en: They were so sure that funds from Nigeria would service the debt.
translation.pcm: Dem dey sure say di moni wey dey kom from Nigeria go fit service di debt

translation.en: But a certain military officer named Muhammadu Buhari was lurking in the shadows, ready to disrupt the Republic that pledged them an enormous amount in tuition fees.
translation.pcm: One military officer wey be Muhammadu Buhari dey lurk for shadow, e dey ready to distrupt di Republic wey pledge dem big moni wey be tuition fee

translation.en: When Buhari disrupted the Republic, it was no news that UCC was on the verge of bankruptcy.
translation.pcm: Wen Buhari distrupt di Republic, e no be news say UCC don dey verge of bankruptcy.

translation.en: To make matters worse for UCC, Buharis government came with a policy that the idea of government scholarships being utilised overseas was economically imprudent especially for degree programs that can be conducted in Nigeria.
translation.pcm: To scatter evrithing for UCC, Buhari goment kom outside wit policy say di idea of goment scholarship dem wey dem dey use abroad dey ecnonomically imprudent especially for degree programe wey dem fit do for inside Nigeria

translation.en: Thus, UCC was a UK university, which operated like a Nigerian university because they were so much accustomed to funds from Nigeria, until they learnt lessons out of experience.
translation.pcm: UCC be UK university, wey dey operate like Nigeria university bikos say dem don dey used to funds wey dey kom from Nigeria until experince be dia best teacher

translation.en: To save what was left of UCC, the University of Wales Institute of Science and Technology (UWIST) merged with UCC so that they would have what was then to be called the University of Wales College of Cardiff (UWCC).
translation.pcm: To save di small thing wey UCC still get, University of Wales institute of Science and Technology (UWIST) join bodi wit UCC to form wetin dem call University of Wales College of Cardiff (UWCC)

translation.en: This incident was reported in a paper entitledFinancial management in universities: The lessons from University College, Cardiff, published in Financial Accountability & Management (1988 Jun;4(2):99-112).
translation.pcm: Dis tori wey we tok so be report for inside paper wey dem title Financial management in universities: The lessons from University College, Cardiff, wey dem publish for inside Financial Accountability & Management (1988 Jun;4(2):99-112)

translation.en: The paper describes the circumstances in which UCC reached the verge of bankruptcy, and it does refer to the relationship between UCC and Nigeria concerning international students.
translation.pcm: Di paper tok di circumstances wey UCC dey and how dem reach verge of bankruptcy, and e refer di relationship wey dey between UCC and Nigeria concerning international student dem

translation.en: This institution is the present Cardiff University.
translation.pcm: Na di institution be di present Cardiff University

translation.en: It is not in doubt that Western economies are still dependent on developing countries.
translation.pcm: We no doubt am say Western economy still dey depend on developing kontri dem

translation.en: The nature of African economies perfectly suits developed countries.
translation.pcm: As Africa economy be dey sweet kontri dem wey don develop

translation.en: If Africa were to process all its natural resources, many businesses in the developed countries may fail.
translation.pcm: If Africa fir process dia natural resources, plenty business wey dey develop kontri dem fit fail

translation.en: Many businesses in the United States and the United Kingdom are failing as China is increasingly becoming the worlds manufacturing hub.
translation.pcm: Many business wey dey United States and United Kingdom dey fail as China dey bikom world manufacturing hub

translation.en: It is also in the Wests economic interest for Africa to rely on imports and as safe haven for looted funds.

translation.en: The arguments are as relevant today as they were in the 1950s and 1960s.
translation.pcm: Di argument dey relevant today as dem be for 1950s and 1960s

translation.pcm: Mohammed Dahiru Aminu be Assistant Professor of Petroleum Chemistry for American University wey dey Nigeria.

translation.pcm: You fit reach am for social media platforms.

translation.en: Foundation trains 200 Enugu entrepreneurs
translation.pcm: 200 entrepreneurs na dem one Foundation train for Enugu

translation.en: At least 200 youths in Udi Local Government Area of Enugu State have graduated from a three-month Youth ICT and Skill Acquisition Project (YISAP) of the Baywood Foundation.
translation.pcm: At least, 200 youths for Udi Local goment wey dey Enugu State don graduate for 3 months Youth ICT and Skil Acquisition Project wey Baywood Foundation organise for di area

translation.en: The young people were trained on entrepreneurship/vocational skills such as ICT, photography, video-editing, barbing, digital marketing, graphics design, confectionery and other small scale enterprises.
translation.pcm: Na for vocational skil like ICT, photography, digital marketing, graphic desigh, confectionery and odas na em dey train dem on.

translation.en: The foundation, in January, 2021, got a $98,925 grant from the Coca-Cola Foundation to empower 600 youths in Enugu State.
translation.pcm: For January 2021, na em di Foundation get a $98,925 grant from Coca-Cola Foundation make dem use am empower 600 youths for inside Enugu State

translation.en: The 200 trained youths are from Enugu West Senatorial Zone, while 200 youths will be trained in Igboeze North Council (Enugu North Senatorial Zone) and 200 youths of Enugu East Council (Enugu East Senatorial Zone).
translation.pcm: Di 200 youth kom from inside Enugu West Sednetorial Zone, dem go train anoda 200 youth dem for inside Igboese North Council (Enugu North Senatorial Zone) and anoda 200 youth dem wey dey Enugu East Council (Enugu East Senatorial Zone).

translation.en: At least 100 exceptional youths will get a seed grant of N45,000 and N60,000 each from the 600 participants selected for the project.
translation.pcm: 100 youth dem wey do well well go get seed grant of N45,000 and N60,000 each for inside di 600 pipo wey dey participate for di project

translation.en: He also said 33 out of the 200 graduating youths with outstanding performance would be given grants.
translation.pcm: E tok say 33 of di 200 pipo wey dey graduate wey get better performance go get grant

translation.en: The Chairman of Udi Council, Chief Ifeanyi Agu, advised the graduating youths to put in their best and take advantage of the opportunity provided by what they had learnt.
translation.pcm: Chief Ifeanyi Agu wey be di Chairman of Udi Council advise di youth ey dey graduate say make dem put dia best and make dem take advantage of di oppurtunity inside wetin dey don learn

translation.en: A beneficiary, Mrs Anthonia Ugwu, encouraged her fellow youths to utilise the skills they had learnt to double their influence and income in life.
translation.pcm: Mrs Anthonia Ugwu, wey be one of di beneficiary dey encourage her colleage say make dem utilise di skil dem wey dem don learn to double dia influence and inkom inside life.

translation.en: A suspected explosion has hit the popular Mile 3 Park market in Diobu axis of Port Harcourt, causing panic on Monday morning.
translation.pcm: Explosion don hit Mile 3 park market for Diobu area for Port Harcourt, wey kos panic for Monday morning

translation.en: The incident took place at about 6:20am when traders were bringing in their goods into the park, witnesses said.
translation.pcm: Di incident apun around 6:20am wen trader dem dey bring dia goods inside park, witness tok

translation.en: One person was injured in the leg, while few others sustained injuries in a stampede that followed.
translation.pcm: Na leg one person injure, plenty oda pipo get injury as all of dem dey run for dia life

translation.en: Many traders in the market quickly parked their goods and left the park after the explosion.
translation.pcm: Many trader dem quickly park dia goods for di market and dem leave di park afta di exposion

translation.en: The personnel of the Nigeria Police Force believed to have come from Nkpolu Police Division, Port Harcourt immediately moved to the scene of the incident.
translation.pcm: Nigeria Police force pipo wey e be like say dem kom from Nkpolu Police Division, Port Harcourt kom to di scene of di incident

translation.en: When contacted the State Police Command, spokesperson, SP Nnamdi Omoni, said that he is yet to get detailed information about the incident.
translation.pcm: SP Nnamdi Omoni, wey be State Police Command wey dem contact am tok say e neva get detail information about di incident.

translation.en: Armed policemen take over PDP secretariat
translation.pcm: policeman dem wey carry gun take ova PDP secretariat

translation.en: Armed policemen have been deployed to the premises of the Peoples Democratic Party state secretariat in Calabar.
translation.pcm: Armed policeman dem don dey deploye to di premise of pipo Democratic parti wey dey Calabar

translation.en: Their unusual presence was noticed since Saturday morning.
translation.pcm: Na since Saturday morning we don notice dia unusual presence for there

translation.en: A bystander said, The security operatives numbering about 50 came in unmarked pickup trucks and have blocked access from the nearby Kia motor shop all the way to the secretariat, located along the Murtala Muhammed Highway in Calabar.
translation.pcm: One bystander tok say di security operative wey plenty reach ova 50 kom for inside pickup truck dem wey dey unmark and dem block access from Kia motor hop wey dey near to di way to di secretariat, wey dey along Muritala Muhammed Highway for Calabar.

translation.en: Their presence might be to avert possible backlash as the landlord is said to be out to evict the party which reportedly was heavily indebted to him.
translation.pcm: Dia presence fit be say make dem avart backlash as di landlord don dey out to evict di parti wey dey indebted to am.

translation.en: Meanwhile, the immediate past State Chairman of the party who has also been serving as caretaker committee Chairman, Ntufam Inok Edim has given impression that the two-storey building might be converted for other use.
translation.pcm: Ntufam Inok Edim wey be di immediate past State Chairman of di parti wey don dey serve as caretaker committee Chairman don give impression say di two-storey building fit dey convert for oda use.

translation.en: painters have started to change the colour of the building.
translation.pcm: painter dem don dey change di colour of di building

translation.en: The PDP flag has been brought down.
translation.pcm: Dem don carry di PDP flag kom down.

translation.en: Alhaji Saad Abubakar III, the Sultan of Sokoto, has advocated the use of Hijab by Muslim women.
translation.pcm: Alhaji Saad Abubakar III, di sultan of Sokoto, don dey advocate di use of Hijab by Muslim woman dem.

translation.en: Abubakar wondered why the wearing of the Hijab would be a problem for others who were not using it, stressing that the other religions could also be encouraged to adopt what their religions order them to do.
translation.pcm: Abubakar dey wonder why hijab wearing be problem to pipo dem wey no dey wear am, tok say oda religion dem fit encourage wetin dia religion tok say made dem dey do.

translation.en: Almighty God created us to worship Him
translation.pcm: God create us make we dey worship am.

translation.en: and you must protect my rights as a Muslim, in whatever documents you are going to bring and there are no two ways about it.
translation.pcm: and you suppose dey protect my rights as muslim for any document dem wey you go dey bring and e go get two ways to do am.

translation.en: I must have freedom to worship Allah the way Almighty says I should worship Him.
translation.pcm: I must get freedom to dey worship Allah di way hin want make I dey worship am.

translation.en: So, why do people make too much noise about Shariah and its implementation?
translation.pcm: Why pipo dey open mouth dey make noise about sharia and how dem dey implement am.

translation.en: It is all about our lives as Muslims from the day of our birth till we die.
translation.pcm: E also dey about awa live as Muslim from di day wey we commot awa mama stomach till di day we change address go heaven.

translation.en: So, look at the way to protect the interests of Muslims that constitute over 50 per cent of this nations population.
translation.pcm: Look for ways wey you fit use protect di interest of muslims wey be ova 50% of dis kontri population.

translation.en: Whether in the North, East, South or West.
translation.pcm: Whether na North, East, South ot na West.

translation.en: I believe nobody should stop me from practising my religion and I must practice it to the best of my ability, without tampering with other religions or their freedom.
translation.pcm: I believe say nobodi suppose stop me say make I no practise my religion and I must practise am well well, witout make I dey tamper wit oda pipo religion or dia freedom.

translation.en: You can pick a stone and keep it in your home; that is the problem between you and your God, not me.
translation.pcm: You fit carry stone go house dey keep, na between you and your God dat wan dey.

translation.en: There are so many cases where young girls were denied the right to use their hijabs in schools.
translation.pcm: Many case dey wey small small girl dem dey deny dem make dem dey use hijab for school.

translation.en: Why is it that the use of the hijab becomes a problem to those people who are not using hijab?
translation.pcm: Why em be say hijab be problem to pipo wey no dey use hijab?

translation.en: On the other hand, we should even encourage persons of other faiths to do what their religions ordered them to do.
translation.pcm: And sef, make we encourage pipo wey dey do anoda religion make dem do wetin dia religion tok.

translation.en: And that is how we will live in peace, he said.
translation.pcm: And na how we go live  in peace be dat, he tok.

translation.en: All of you knew that before 1914, there was no Nigeria; but there was Sokoto Caliphate, Kanem Borno Empire, Oyo Empire and Benin Kingdom.
translation.pcm: All of una know say before 1914, Nigeria no dey, but Sokoto Caliphate, Kanem Borno Empire, Oyo Empire and Benin Kingdom dey.

translation.en: The amalgamation of all these led to Nigeria of today as they took power from the people and put it on a few civilians.
translation.pcm: Na almagamation of all diz form wetin be Nigeria and dem collect power from di pipo and give small pipo.

translation.en: Why are politicians afraid of giving power back to the people they have been living and working with closely?
translation.pcm: Why politician dem dey afraid to give power back to pipo wey dem don dey live and work wit.

translation.en: We have accepted the change and we are ready to help; the earlier we realise we can work together, the better for us.
translation.pcm: We don accept di change and we fit help; di earlier we know say we suppose dey work togeda, na di better e dey for us.

translation.en: The political class should know that we are not in any competition with them.
translation.pcm: Make di political class dem know say we no dey do competition wit dem.

translation.en: We are here to help and we are ready to help, he said.
translation.pcm: We dey here to help and we dey ready to help, hin tok.

translation.en: The Sultan added that with adequate political will, the insecurity bedeviling the country was surmountable.
translation.pcm: Di sultan add say wit adequate political will, di insecurity wey dey show di kontri wayo go waka pass.

translation.en: He said the constitution review should also stress religious tolerance and freedom through which peace and stability would be promoted.
translation.pcm: E tok saymake di constitution review touchlight religious tolerance and freedom wey go make peace and stability dey.

translation.en: We believe that the GID will provide room for deeper engagement and inclusion of women, youth, PWDs, IDPs, and other marginalized groups in the electoral process.
translation.pcm: We believe say GID go get deeper engagement and inclusion of women, outh, PWDs, IDPs, and oda group dem wey dey  marginalized  for di electoral process.

translation.en: This should uphold the fundamental principles of participation, inclusion, and representation on which a healthy representative democracy is based.
translation.pcm: Dis suppose uphold  principles of participation, inclusion, and representation wey good representative democracy dey on top

translation.en: While hoping the purpose of the newly established department will also promote and increase the integrity and credibility of our electoral process, we call on INEC to review other recommendations in the advisory.
translation.pcm: As we dey hop say di department wey we just create go promote integrity and credibility of awa electoral process, wey want make INEC review oda recommendation for di advisory

translation.en: These include uploading results sheets at ward, local government and state levels to the results viewing portal, uploading electoral data and materials on INECs website, she said.
translation.pcm: She ok say em include make dem upload result for ward, local goment and state level to di result viewing portal, make dem upload electoral material for INEC website.

translation.en: Hamman-Obels added that ahead of the 2023 elections, the organisation believe that these recommendations will help to further strengthen the integrity and credibility of the nations electoral process.
translation.pcm: Hamman-Obels add say as dem dey look at 2023 election, di organisation believe say diz recommendation go help dem strengthen di integrity and credibility of di nation electoral process.

translation.en: Fire service gets 20 new ambulances, 7 firefighting trucks
translation.pcm: Dem give Fire Service 20 new ambulance dem and 7 fire fighting truck

translation.en: The Federal Fire Service, FFS, has received 20 newly procured Basic Life Support (BLS) modern ambulance buses and seven firefighting trucks.
translation.pcm: Di Federal Fire Service, FFS, don receive 20 new procured Basic Life Support (BLS) wey be modern ambulance bus and seven firefighting truck.

translation.en: The Minister of Interior, Rauf Aregbesola, while speaking at the commissioning ceremony of the equipment in Abuja on Tuesday, said they were part of the N10.4 billion infrastructure upgrade approved by the Federal Executive Council on March 3.
translation.pcm: Aregbesola wey be Minister of Interior, wen e dey tok for di ceremony wey dem dey commission di equipment for Abuja for Tuesday tok say na part of di N10.3 billion infracstucture upgrade wey di Federal Executive Council approve for March 3 em be.

translation.en: The minister said the arrival of the new ambulance buses and trucks and their deployment to the various zonal and state commands would enhance the service delivery of the FFS during emergencies.
translation.pcm: Di minister tok say di arrival of di new ambulance bus and truck dem and dia deployment to different zone and state command go make di service delivery of FFS better.

translation.en: Aregbesola lamented that the year 2020 into 2021 had witnessed frightening fire incidents, ranging from markets to gas and pipelines fires around the country.
translation.pcm: Aregbesola dey lament say di year 2020 wey go inside 2021 don see fire incident wey dey fear person, from market to gas and pipeline fire for evriwhere for di kontri

translation.en: Statistics at our disposal show that the FFS in 2020 to the first quarter of 2021 received 4,541 fire calls from which regrettably, 158 lives were lost and property loss is estimated at N41.5 billion, he said.
translation.pcm: Di statistics wey we get dey show say di FFS for 2020 reach first quarter for 2021 receive 4,541 fire call wey 158 pipo lost dia live dem and property for fire incident wey dey occur for di kontri

translation.en: Aregbesola urged the state governors and the local government chairmen to invest in firefighting as well in order to reduce the loss of lives and property from fire incidents across the country.
translation.pcm: Aregbesola advise state giverment and local goment chairmo make dem invest inside firefighting to allow make dem reduce how pipo dey change adress go heaven and how property dey destroy for fire incident for di kontri

translation.en: Speaking earlier, the Controller-General of the FFS, Dr Liman Ibrahim, said the Services operational scope had spanned all the states of the federation and the FCT.
translation.pcm: Controller General of FFS wey don tok before, Dr Liman Ibrahim, tok say di service operational scope don span all ova di state wey dey di kontri and di FCT

translation.en: He said the FFS would commence deployment of itspersonnel and assets to the 72 remaining Senatorial Districts before the end of this year.
translation.pcm: E tok say di FFS go start to dey deploy personnel and asset to di 72 senetorial district wey remain before di year end

translation.en: two Deputy Controller-Generals (DCG Quintus G. Azogu and DCG Callistus Agu) and an Assistant Controller-General, ACG Thompson Mohammed, were pulled out to mark their retirement from the service.
translation.pcm: DCG Quintus G. Azogu and DCG Callistus Agu dem wey be Deputy Controller-Generals and  ACG Thompson Mohammed wey be Assistant Controller-General na dem coomot and dem mark dia retirement from service.

translation.en: NDLEA raises alarm over rising drug addiction in Jigawa
translation.pcm: NDLEA don raise alarm ova drug addiction for Jigawa

translation.en: The National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) in Jigawa State has expressed concerns over the rising rate of hard drugs consumption, especially among students of tertiary institutions, in the state.
translation.pcm: Di National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) wey dey Jigawa State don raise concern ova hard drug consumption wey dey go up especially among student dem wey dey tertiary institution wey dey di state

translation.en: The states Commander of NDLEA, Hajiya Maryam Gambo Sani, while speaking with Daily Trust, decried the increasing rate of drug consumption, which she said had heightened cases of delinquency in the state.
translation.pcm: Hajiya Maryam Gambo Sani, wey be di state Commander of NDLEA,  wen e dey tok to Daily Trust decry drug consumption wey dey go up, wey she tok say em don heighten case of delinquency for di state

translation.en: She noted that between February and May, a total of 21.63 kilogrammes of banned substances were seized by the agency in the state, and 108 suspects nabbed: 103 males and five females.
translation.pcm: Sge tok say between February and May, di agency wey dey di state sieze 21.63 kilogramme of ban substance, and dem catch 108 suspect dem: 103 male and 5 female
