translation.en: It is clear to us now that there is one power somewhere
translation.pcm: E don clear now say one power dey somewer for awa side

translation.en: that is overall power controlling them.
translation.pcm: Dat one na di ovaall power wey dey control dem

translation.en: But, if they want to be fair with all the political parties, and want local government elections to be free and fair, they should listen to us, guide the date they gave us, and go along with the constitution that guides OGSIEC.
translation.pcm: But, if dey wan good for di political party dem, and if dey want make local goment election dey free and fair, make dem hear us, guide di date wey dem give us, make dey kom follow di constitution wey dey guide OGSIEC

translation.en: If they dont do that, we wont mind going to court with them.
translation.pcm: If dey no do dat one, we no go mind follow dem go court

translation.en: Meanwhile, Governor Abiodun has promised that the local government elections slated for July 24, would not be skewed in favour of the ruling party.
translation.pcm: Meanwhile, governor Abiodun don promise say the election wey dey wan do for 24 July, no go favour di party wey dey rule

translation.en: Abiodun told the party leaders that he would not share political positions among men and women who are party faithful during the elections, but promote equal participation, noting that leaders of the ruling party in the state must show that they are products of democracy.
translation.pcm: Abiodun tell di parti leaders say hin no go give pipo wey dey loyal for hin parti for election time political position, but  ay hin go promote equal participation, he add say, di leaders for di rulin parti must show say dem practice photographer

translation.en: We must be consistent; we must show that we have learnt from other peoples lessons and that we are the product of democracy.
translation.pcm: We must dey consistent, we must show say we don learn from oda pipo lesson, and we be wetin democracy produce

translation.en: We have done primaries when somebody else did not want primaries.
translation.pcm: We don do primary wen one pesin no wan do am

translation.en: We subjected ourselves to the party process; we evolved through that process which was later confirmed by the general elections despite all odds.
translation.pcm: We surrender awasef for di parti process, we kom change through di process wey di general election kom later confirm, despite all di odds

translation.en: Let us make sure that whatever process we adopt is democratic, we must be seen as true progressive democrats.
translation.pcm: Make we make sure say all di process wey we do dey democratic, na must make dem see us as true progressive democrats.

translation.en: When it comes to a process like this, what we need to do is to encourage our women to participate, to come forward and participate, we will vote for them.
translation.pcm: Wen e be say na dis kind process, wetin we need na to encourage awa women make dem participate, make dem kom front kom participate, we go vote dem

translation.en: But we are not going to share it and say because you are a woman, you take this.
translation.pcm: But we no go share am say bikos you be woman, you take dis one

translation.en: No, that will be undemocratic.
translation.pcm: No, e no go be democracy

translation.en: We are not going to do that, there will be fairness,he stated.
translation.pcm: He tok say; we no go do dat one, evrithin go dey fair

translation.en: Nadal brushes past Opelka into 12th Rome final
translation.pcm: Nadal win Opelka enta Rome 12th final

translation.en: Nine-time champion
translation.pcm: Nine-time Champion

translation.en: Rafael Nadal advanced to the Italian Open final for the 12th time on Saturday with a 6-4, 6-4 win over American Reilly Opelka.
translation.pcm: Rafael Nadal advance go Italian Open final for di 12th time on Saturday wit 6-4, 6-4 win ova America Reilly Opelka

translation.en: The Spaniard will play either defending champion Novak Djokovic or Italian Lorenzo Sonego in what will also be his 52nd Masters final.
translation.pcm: Di Spainard go play if na to defend Champion Novak Djokovic or Lorenzo Sonego wey kom from Italy for wetin go be hin 52nd Masters final

translation.en: Playing his 500th clay-court match, Nadal staved off break points in the fourth game of the first set and did not look back to win through in 1hr 32min.
translation.pcm: As he dey play for hin 500th clay-court march, Nadal stave off break points for di fourth game for di first set and he no look back till hin win through for 1hr 32min

translation.en: Friesland records N199.5bn turnover
translation.pcm: Friesland record N199.5bn turnova

translation.en: FrieslandCampina WAMCO Nigeria PLC, manufacturers of premium milk brands  Peak, Three Crowns, Coast, Nunu and Olympic has reported a turnover of N199.5 billion.
translation.pcm: FrieslandCampina WAMCO Nigeria PLC, company wey dey manufacture premium milk brand like Peak, Three Crowns, Coast, Nunu and Olympic milk don report say dey get turnova of N199.5billion

translation.en: The company disclosed this at its 48th Annual General Meeting held in Lagos.
translation.pcm: Di company tok am for dia 48th Annual General Meetin wey dem dey do for Lagos

translation.en: Speaking at the AGM, the Chairman, Mr. Moyo Ajekigbe, said: The challenging operating environment in 2020 notwithstanding, the Companys commercial and financial performance for the year showed considerable improvement compared to the previous year.
translation.pcm: As he dey tok for di AGM, Di Chairman, Mr Moyo Ajekigbe, tok say: Di operatin environment wey dey challengin for 2020 plus di company commercial and financial performace for di year show big improvement if you compare am to last year own

translation.en: Turnover increased by 23% in 2020 to N199.5billion from N161.8billion in 2019.
translation.pcm: Di turnova increase wit 23% for 2020 to 199.5 billion from 161.8 billion for 2019

translation.en: He said the growth was due to a combined effect of organic and inorganic growth following the acquisition of Nutricimas dairy business.
translation.pcm: He tok say di growth na bikos of organic and inorganic growth wey dem get afta dey buy Nutricima dairy business.

translation.en: A breakdown of the financials indicates that Profit Before Tax however decreased by 20.3% from N18.8 billion in 2019 to N14.9 billion in 2020 as a result of high input costs and naira devaluation impact.
translation.pcm: As dey break di financial down, e show say di profit wey dem get before dey pay tax decrease wit 20.3% from N18.8billion for 2019 go N14.9billion for 2020 bikos of high input cost and naira wey don devalue

translation.en: All the resolutions submitted for shareholder approval were adopted, including the approval of a total dividend payout of N6.74 per N0.50 share.
translation.pcm: Di shareholders approve all di resolution wey dey submit

translation.en: The Managing Director, Mr. Ben Langat, in his presentation, noted that   the year 2020 was shaped by the companys continued focus on sustainable business processes.
translation.pcm: Di Managing Director, Mr. Ben Langat for hin presentation tok say di year 2020 be like dat bikos di company focus on top sustainable business symptoms wey continue.

translation.en: Ahmed Gulak Killed by unknown Gunmen in Owerri
translation.pcm: Unknown Gunmen kil Ahmed Gulak for Owerri

translation.en: The former Special Adviser (Politics) to President Goodluck Jonathan, Ahmed Gulak, has been killed by unknown gunmen in Owerri, Imo state.
translation.pcm: Unknown Gunmen kil Former Special adviser (Politics) for President Goodluck Jonathan, Ahmed Gulak for Owerri, Imo state.

translation.en: It was gathered that Gulak was killed at Obiangwu along Aba-Owerri road on his way to the airport apparently to board a flight to Abuja on Sunday morning.
translation.pcm: Dey found out say dey kill Gulak for Obiangwu along Aba-Owerri road as he dey go airport go enta plane wey dey go Abuja for Sunday mornin.

translation.en: A Facebook post by one of his friends, Umar Ardo, read: I just confirmed the sad and gruesome death of my friend and classmate, the former Hon.
translation.pcm: One of hin friend, Umar Ardo, post for facebook say: I just confirm di sad and gruesome death of my friend and former classmate, di Former Hon.

translation.en: Speaker of the Adamawa State Assembly, former Special Assistant Political to President Goodluck Jonathan,
translation.pcm: Speaker for Adamawa state Assembly, Former Special Assistant Political for President Goodluck Jonathan

translation.en: Barr Ahmed Ali Gulak was said to have been killed last night by unknown gunmen in Owerri, Imo State.
translation.pcm: Barr. Ahmad Ali Gulak, na hin dem tok say unknown Gunmen kil for Owerri, Imo state, yesterday night.

translation.en: A statement signed by the Police Public Relations Officer in the state command, SP Bala Elkana, confirmed Gulaks killing, adding that the security agency would probe the incident.
translation.pcm: One statement wey di Police Public Relations Officer for state command sigh confirm say na kil dem kil Gulak, he kom add say di security agency go probe di situation

translation.en: On the 30/5/2021, at about 07:20 am armed bandits intercepted and attacked a Toyota Camry cab carrying Ahmed Gulak and two others who were on their way to Sam Mbakwe Airport to catch a flight.
translation.pcm: On di 30/5/2021, around 7:30 am, arm robbers block and attack one Toyota Camry Cab wey dey carry Ahmed Gulak and three oda pipo go Sam Mbakwe Airport go enta plane

translation.en: The Commissioner of Police Imo, CP Abutu Yaro, has directed a discreet investigation into the matter as tactical and special forces have been deployed to cordon the area and arrest perpetrators,the statement said.
translation.pcm: Di statement tok say di commissioner of Police Imo, CP Abutu Yaro, don direct discreet investigation for di mata as  he don put tactical and special force circle di area, make dem fit arrest di bad pipo dem.

translation.en: Taming Nigerias oil spillage and gas flaring scourge
translation.pcm: To tame Nigeria oil spillage and gas flarin scourge

translation.en: By Jerome-Mario Utomi
translation.pcm: E kom from Jerome Mario-Utami

translation.en: The recent news report that the Okordia-Rumekpe 14-inch crude truck line operated by Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC) discharged some 213 barrels of crude oil into the Ikarama community in Bayelsa, has again brought to our consciousness that though Nigeria prides itself as the giant of Africa and the most populous black nation in the world, yet, it is still riddled with third world challenges.
translation.pcm: Di recent news report say Okordia-Rumekpe 14-inch crude truck line wey Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC) dey operate discharge 213 barrel crude oil for Ikarama community for Bayelsa don reach awa side say though Nigeria wey been dey proud say dey be giant of Africa and di black kontri wey get pipo pass for di world stil dey get plenti third world kasala

translation.en: Essentially, while clarifying that an estimated 1.34 hectares of land was polluted by the leakage, which followed a rupture on the pipeline, SPDC among other things confirmed that probe into the incident had been concluded, noting that out of the 213 barrels of SPDCs bonny light crude stream leak, some 110 barrels are recoverable from the ongoing recovery exercise at the site, leaving an estimated spilled volume at 109.12 barrels.
translation.pcm: As dem dey clarify say na like 1.34 hectare land dem pollute wit di leakage wey rupture for di pipeline follow, SPDC confirm say dey finish di investigation of di incident, dey tok say out of 213 of SPDC bonny light crude leak, na like 110 barrel dem see recover for di recovery exercise wey dem dey do for di site, e kom remain 109.12 barrel of di volume wey spill.

translation.en: Admittedly, these claims by the Dutch oil giant are verifiable facts but may not be the only explanation.
translation.pcm: Admittedly, wetin Dutch oil giant claim na fact wey dem fit verify but e fit no be di only explanation

translation.en: Their clarification notwithstanding, there are indeed reasons that qualify such happening in Nigerias oil and gas industry as a reality that demands holistic analysis.
translation.pcm: Notwitstandin dia clarification,reasons dey wey qualify dis kind apunin for Nigeria oil and gas industry as reality wey dey suppose analyse generally

translation.en: Lets begin with reality.
translation.pcm: Make we start wit reality

translation.en: Aside from the awareness that spillage occurs, communal rights to a clean environment and access to clean water supplies are violated in such cases and the oil industry, by its admission, has abandoned thousands of polluted sites in the region, which needs to be identified and studied in details while communities adversely affected are adequately compensated for their losses, this latest spill is coming weeks after a similar one from a ruptured pipeline facility managed by one of the International Oil Companies operating in the Niger Delta that reportedly ravaged Benikrukru and adjourning communities in Warri South West Local Government Area of Delta State.
translation.pcm: Aside from di awareness say spillage dey happen, communal right for environment wey clean and access for clean water supply na hin dey don violate for dat kind case, wit dia admission, dey don abandon thousands of site wey dey don pollute for di region, wey dem nid identify and study for detail as dey compensate di community wey e affect well for dia loss wella, dis lastest spill apun weeks afta one wey resemble am for one pipeline facility wey rupture wey one International Oil company wey dey  operate for Niger Delta dey manage, wey dem report say destroy Benikrukru and commuinty wey dey around am for Warri South-west local goment Area for Delta state.

translation.en: And another in the early hours of Sunday, March 14, 2021, at Polobubo/Opuama Communities, Warri North Local Government Area of the state, could settle.
translation.pcm: And anoda one for early momo on Sunday, March 14,2021 for Polubobu / Opuama, Warri North local Goment Area for di state, go fit settle.

translation.en: Such litany of spillages also include but not limited to, namely; the historic large scale spillages in places such as the Ogoni Land, Rivers State and the Erovie community in Ozoro, Isoko North Local Government of Delta State 1990s, both in the Nigerias South South geopolitical zones, of which their negative impacts linger.
translation.pcm: Dis kind big scale set of spillage also include but e no dey limited to; di big spillage wey dey history for place like Ogini land, Rivers State and Erovie community for Ozoro, Isoko North Local Goment for Delta state for 1990s, di two for Nigeria south south zone and negative impact still dey der.

translation.en: Are these the only explanations/examples?
translation.pcm: Shey na di only explanation /example dem be dis?

translation.en: The answer is a definite
translation.pcm: Di answer na ogbonge

translation.en: no, as there exist yet
translation.pcm: no, as oda ones dey

translation.en: other critical reasons/concerns why we should view the situation as a crisis.
translation.pcm: Oda critical reason / concern dem why we suppose see di situation as crisis.

translation.en: First and very fundamental is the inability of Nigeria and Nigerians to appreciate and treat crude oil spillage and environmental pollution resulting from exploration/crude oil production related activities as a national calamity.
translation.pcm: Di first and veri important na di inability of Nigeria and hin pipo to appreciate and treat activity wey relate to crude oil spillage and environment pollution wey dey kom from exploration/crude oil production as national calamity

translation.en: The second is the stunning consciousness that gas flaring/environmental degradation resulting from crude oil prospecting/production-related activities in the country is under reported.
translation.pcm: Di second na di stunnin conciousness wey gas flarin/ environment degradation dey apun bikos of activities wey dey related to crude oil prospectin/ production for di kontri dey under-reported.

translation.en: This second concern stems from a recent comment, which according to media report was credited to the Director-General, National Oil Spill Detection and Response Agency, (NOSDRA), Idris Musa, who stated that findings by his agency showed that an average of five oil spills was recorded daily in Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Dis second concern dey kom from one recent comment, wey be say from media report na from di Director-General, National Oil Spill Detection and Response Agency (NOSDRA), Idris Musa, wey tok say wetin hin agency find show say average of five oil spills na hin Nigeria dey record evriday.

translation.en: Musa, who spoke to journalists in Abuja, said, In 2018 we had about 600 oil spill incidents and in 2019, we had over 700 oil spill-impacted sites across the country.
translation.pcm: Musa, wey follow journalists tok for Abuja, tok say for 2018, we get 600 oil spill incident and for 2019, we get about 700 oil spill-impacted site actross di kontri.

translation.en: This wakeful comment becomes even more relevant to the present discourse when one remembers that Nigeria according to reports is dotted with about 139 gas flare locations spread across the Niger Delta both in onshore and offshore oil fields where gas which constitutes about 11 percent of the total gas produced are flared.
translation.pcm: Dis comment wey dey open brain dey more important for wetin we dey discourse if pesin remember say Nigeria accordin to report don get about 139 place wey gas don flare across Niger Delta both for di oil fields wey dey water and di one wey no dey, wer gas wey dey flare dey reach 11% of evrithin wey dem dey produce.

translation.en: More than anything else, it brings to mind the questions as to; what exactly impedes the development of the petroleum sector and Niger Delta region?
translation.pcm: Pass anything, na di question dem wey e bring kom mind be; wetin dey stop di development of petroleum sector and Niger Delta region

translation.en: Are there no legislative works?
translation.pcm: Shey Legislative work no dey?

translation.en: Why is such a legislative framework not providing a strong source of remedy for individuals and communities negatively affected by oil exploration and production in the coastal communities?
translation.pcm: Why dis kind legislative framework no dey provide strong source of solution for pipo and community wey oil exploration and production affect badly for coastal comminity dem?

translation.en: If these frameworks exist, why is it not effective and enforceable?
translation.pcm: If dis framework dey, why e no dey work or make dem do am?

translation.en: Is the framework as comprehensive as a legal solution to the issues of oil-related violations?
translation.pcm: Shey di framework get evrithin  like legal solution for di issues of violations wey relate to oil?

translation.en: Why has the nation not learned a valid lesson from the Dutch government where all operators are required to restore their areas of operation back to how nature intended?
translation.pcm: Why di nation neva learn serious lesson from Dutch goment wia all di pipo wey dey operate must restore wia dem dey operate back to how dey meet am?

translation.en: Regardless of what others may say, the truth is that if as a nation we are desirous of developing policies that will engineer prosperity in the oil and gas sectors while saving the people of the region, then, we must be ready to locate the strategic triangles that hold the key to success.
translation.pcm: Regardless of wetin oda pipo tok, di truth be say if all of us get am for mind to develop policy wey go bring prosperity for oil and gas sector, while we go still save di pipo for di region, we ready to find di strategic triangles wey hold di key to success for hand.

translation.en: Separate from the fact that success requires a careful analysis of the various kinds of knowledge needed to make innovation possible, the need for the nation to straddle the middle ground has become necessary since both the ministry and sector have for a very long time manifested signs of an institution with neither primed nor positioned potentials.
translation.pcm: Apart from di fact say success need make dem analyse am wit care, of di different kind of knowledge wey dem need to make innovation possible, e don necessary for di nation make dem hold di middle ground since both di ministry and sector don dey manifest signs for long time now say dem go be institution wey no get potential wey strong.

translation.en: And as we know, any organisation, be it private or public that fails to search for its potentials leaves its survival to chance.
translation.pcm: And as we know, any organization, whether private or public wey no gree search for hin potential, hin survival na by chance.

translation.en: At this instant, looking at both the operational templates of the ministry and how the up, mid and the downstream players of the petroleum industry have become reputed for non-compliance to set rules,  it will not be a wrong assertion to conclude that the critical factors fueling crude oil spillage/gas flaring can be divided into the following; the existence of  multiple but obsolete regulatory framework, which characterises the oil and gas exploration and production in Nigeria; federal governments failure to get the nations refineries back to full refining capacity; the petroleum ministrys inability to get committed  to making International Oil Companies(IOCs) adhere strictly to the international best practices as it relates to their operational environment; And finally, non-existence of clear responsibility/work details and action plans for agencies and parastatals functioning under the ministry.
translation.pcm: For dis level, if we luk di operational template of di ministry, and how dey don know say di up, mid and down stream players of di petroleum industry say dem no dey follow rules, e no go dey wrong make pesin conclude say dem fit divide di serious reasons wey dey kos Crude oil spillage/gas flarin to; regulatory framework wey plenti wey no dey work, oil and gas exploration and production for Nigeria dey; federal goment failure to make di kontri refineries dey work to dia full capacity back ; petroleum ministry inability to make International Oil Companies dey follow di international best practices as e relate to di environment wey dem dey work; Di last one, clear responsibility/work details wey no dey and action plans for agencies and parastatals wey dey function under di ministry.

translation.en: The above failures have as a direct consequence; cast a long dark shadow on the ministry, the sector and the region.
translation.pcm: Di failures dem wey dey up get direct consequence, na bad influence for di sector, di ministry and di region.

translation.en: To explain these points beginning with the first challenge, it is worth commenting that the business of crude oil exploration and issues of oil production in the country is regulated by multiple but very weak laws and Acts of which most of these laws not only complicate enforcement but are curiously too old-fashioned for the changing demands of time thereby, creating loopholes for operators, especially the International Oil Companies (IOC) to exploit both the government and host communities.
translation.pcm: To take explain dis points, make we use di first challenge start, e dey important to dey tok about di law dem wey regulate crude oil exploration and oil production issue wey plenti law dey regulate but too dey weak and di Acts wey dey law wey no dey just complicate how e dey work, but e don too old as time don dey change, e dey create corner corner way for pipo wey dey operate for der especially the International Oil Companies (IOC)  make dem fit use exploit both di goment and host communities.

translation.en: Some of these laws/Acts in question that have been in operation since the 1960s but currently not achieving their purpose includes but not limited to; the Petroleum Act of 1969, The Harmful Waste(Special Criminal Positions etc), Act 1988, Mineral Oil Safety Regulation 1963, Petroleum(Drilling and Production) Regulation 1969
translation.pcm: some of dis laws/acts wey we dey tok about don dey since 1960 but dey no dey achieve dia purpose wey Di Petroleum Act of 1969, Di Harmful Waste(Special Criminal Positions etc), Act 1988, Mineral Oil Safety Regulation 1963, Petroleum(Drillin and Production) Regulation 1969 dey but no be oly dis one dem.

translation.en: (Subsidiary Legislation to the Petroleum Act) and the off-shore Oil Revenue (Registration of Grants)Act 1971 among others.
translation.pcm: (Subsidiary Legislation to Petroleum Act) and di off-shore Oil Revenue (Registration of Grants) Acts 1971 among odas.

translation.en: Without minding their number, concepts, provisions and definitions, these laws have become obsolete, old-schooled and out-fashioned to the extent that they now provide leeway for the operators in the sector to exploit both the government and host communities.
translation.pcm: As dey no mind di number, concept, provision and definition dem, dis law dem no dey useful again, dey don old to di extent say dem dey give pipo wey dey work for di sector corner corner to dey chop both di goment and host community dem.

translation.en: Utomi is the Programme Coordinator (Media and Policy), Social and Economic Justice Advocacy (SEJA), Lagos
translation.pcm: Utomi na di Programme Coordinator (Media and Policy), Social and Econnomic Justice Advocacy (SEJA) , Lagos.

translation.en: SEC bans unregistered CMOs from operations May 31
translation.pcm: SEC ban CMO wey dey no register from operation May 31

translation.en: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) says it will stop operations of the Capital Market Operators (CMOs) yet to renew their registration on May 31.
translation.pcm: Di Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) tok say dem go stop Capital Market Operators (CMOs) operation wey neva renew dia registration for May 31

translation.en: The commission disclosed this in a circular signed by the management on Monday in Abuja.
translation.pcm: Di commission tok am for one circular wey di management sign on Monday for Abuja

translation.en: The commission said that the CMOs yet to renew their registration at the expiration of late filing on May 31, would not be eligible to operate in the capital market.
translation.pcm: Di commission tok say any CMO wey no renew dia registration before late fillin expire for May 31 no go fit operate for capital market.

translation.en: Consequently, the commission said that late filing for renewal of registration would only be entertained from May 1 to May 31.
translation.pcm: Bikos of wetin dey apun, di commission tok say to dey fill di renewal of registration late go dey between May 1 to May 30

translation.en: It said that the CMOs were required to have completed the renewal process on or before April 30.
translation.pcm: E tok say di CMOs need complete renewal process on or before April 30.

translation.en: The commission noted that names of the CMOs that had renewed their registration would be published on SECs website and national dailies.
translation.pcm: Di commission note say dem go publish di name of di CMOs wey renew dia registration of SEC website and national newspapers dem.

translation.en: It added that the names of eligible CMOs would be communicated to the relevant Securities Exchanges and Trade Associations.
translation.pcm: E kom add say dem go declare di name of CMOs wey dey eligible give relevant security exchange and Trade Associations.

translation.en: The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the SEC had in March issued a circular to the general public and the CMOs for the reintroduction of the periodic renewal of registration by operators.
translation.pcm: Di News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) report say SEC for March don share circular give general public and di CMOs for di periodic renewal of registration by di operator wey dey wan introduce again

translation.en: Kano Pillars go top after 1-1 draw at Katsina United
translation.pcm: Kano Pillars dey top afta 1-1 draw for Katsina United

translation.en: Former champions, Kano Pillars have assumed leadership of the 2021 NPFL table even as they were forced to 1-1 draw by Katsina United in the week 22 match played Sunday at the Muhammadu Dikko stadium in Katsina.
translation.pcm: Former Champions, Kano Pillars don dey top chart back for 2021 NPFL as Katsina United force dem go 1-1 draw for week 22 match wey dey play on Sunday for Muhammed Dikko Stadium for Katsina.

translation.en: Five minutes after Suraj Ayeleso saved Ahmed Rasheeds penalty kick, Pillars inspirational captain, Rabiu Ali popped up at the other end to give the Masu gida boys the lead from a direct free kick in the 26th minute.
translation.pcm: Five minute afta Suraj Ayeleso save di penalty wey Ahmed Rasheed play, Pillars captain wey dey Inspirational, Rabiu Ali show for di oda side score wey make Masu gida boys dey lead from one direct free kick as e reach 26 minute

translation.en: However, Pillars lead was short-lived as Ahmed Rasheed made amends for his earlier miss from the spot by heading home Usman Baraus cross to level scores in the 34th minute.
translation.pcm: Pillars win no tey as Ahmed Rasheed kom later score di goal wey he lose before from di spot as he dey go home, Usman Bara cross to go level scores for di 34th minute.

translation.en: The draw put Pillars on top of the log with 41 points but their reign may not last more than 24 hours, if Akwa United who are on 40 points would beat Rangers today in Uyo.
translation.pcm: Di draw put Kano Pillars for di top wit 41 points but dia reign fit no last 24 hours, if Akwa United wey dey 40 points beat Rangers for Uyo today.

translation.en: In Jos, it was a good day in the office for Plateau United who rubbed more salt into Wikki Tourists injuries with a 4-1 victory.
translation.pcm: For Jos, na beta day for Plateau United as dey put pepe for Wikki Tourist eye wit dia 4-1 victory.

translation.en: Ibrahim Mustapha scored in the 3rd minute from a tight spot to start the rout before Jibrin Abubakar equalised for the hapless Tourists in the 9th minute.
translation.pcm: Ibrahin Muhammed score for di 3rd minute from one bad corner take start di game, before Jibrin Abubakar Equalise for di yeye Tourists wen e reach 9 minute.

translation.en: Thereafter, it was one way traffic as Mohammed Zulkifilu scored a brace (17, 55) before Oche Ohowechi put the icing on the cake for Plateau United in the 90th minute.
translation.pcm: Na one way traffic as Muhammed Zulkifilu score brace (17, 55) before Oche Ohowechi kom show dem who di baba be as he score for 90 minite for Plateau United

translation.en: Nasarawa United also overwhelmed visiting Heartland 3-1 after Aliyu Abdullahi scored a brace (27, 50) and Marthings Owolijah tripled the lead in the 61st minute before Chijoke Akuneto reduced the deficit with a screamer in the 85th minute.
translation.pcm: Nasarawa United sef pepe Heartland wey dey visit 3-1 afta Aliyu Abdullah score brace (27, 50) and Martins Owolijah score di third one wen e reach 61 minute, before Chijioke Akuneto kom boost hin team morale as he score wen e reach 85 minute.

translation.en: In Gombe, host Adamawa United chased Wolves to a 3-3 draw, FC IfeanyiUbah topped Sunshine Stars 1-0 in Nnewi in the battle of relegation teams, MFM piped Lobi Stars 1-0 in Lagos and Abia Warriors
translation.pcm: For Gombe, Adamawa United wey dey host pursue Wolves go 3-3 draw, FC Ifeanyi Ubah win Sunshine stars 1-0 for Nnewi for di battle of Relegation team, MFM sama Lobi stars 1-0 for Lagos and Abia Warriors

translation.en: forced Rivers United to 0-0 draw in Port-Harcourt.
translation.pcm: Force Rivers United go 0-0 draw for Port-Harcourt

translation.en: At the Ahmadu Bello stadium Kaduna, Jigawa Stars left it late to draw 1-1 with visiting Dakkada FC.
translation.pcm: For Ahmadu Bello Stadium Kaduna, Jigawa Stars follow Dakkada Fc wey dey visit draw.

translation.en: While the match between Enyimba and Kwara United didnt hold due to the formers continental engagement, Akwa United will seek to reclaim the top spot from Pillars when they host Rangers this afternoon.
translation.pcm: As Enyimba and Kwara United no play dia match bikos of Enyimba continential engagement, Akwa united go find way reclaim dia top-spot from Pillars wen dey host Rangers dis aftanoon.

translation.en: Golf doesnt depend on govt for foreign journeys  Oyinlola
translation.pcm: Oyinlola tok say Golf no dey depend on goment for foreign journey.

translation.en: The chairman, caretaker committee, Nigeria Golf Federation (NGF), Prince Olagunsoye Oyinlola has said since they came on board in 2017, his federation has been attending international competitions without government support.
translation.pcm: Di Chairman, caretaker committee, Nigeria Golf Federation (NGF), Prince Olugunsoye Oyinlola don tok say since hin and hin pipo enta post for 2017, hin federation been dey attend International competition witout goment support

translation.en: Speaking during the inauguration of the caretaker committees by the Minister of Youth and Sports Development, Sunday Dare on Tuesday, Oyinlola said Ever since we came on board to administer the federation, we have been up and taking part in international competitions and ensuring our golfers are well exposed.
translation.pcm: As  he dey tok for di inarguration of Caretaker committee by di Minister of youth nd spot development, Sunday Dare on Tuesday, Oyinlola tok say, since we don dey administer di federation, we dey do evrithin, we dey take part for international competition and we dey ensure say awa golfers dey exposed well.

translation.en: As president, I have always been taking part in international competitions.
translation.pcm: As President, I don always take part for international competition.

translation.en: We have taken our players to Morocco, Ireland, Botswana, Argentina and Mauritius on our own,he said.
translation.pcm: He tok say; we don take awa players go Morroco, Ireland, Botswana, Argentinga and Mauritius on awa own.

translation.en: He further said the standard of the game has improved and efforts have been made to improve and discover new talents.
translation.pcm: He kom still tok say di standard of di game improve and dey done make effort  to find new talent and na to improve am.

translation.en: I think we have gone a step higher than when we came on board.
translation.pcm: I think say we don dey high pass wen we first start.

translation.en: We have been organizing age-grade competitions to discover new talents.
translation.pcm: We don dey use age-grade competition wey we organise take find new talent.

translation.en: We have been keeping faith with our programs as far as golf is concerned.
translation.pcm: We still get faith wit awa program for golf mata.

translation.en: If we find ourselves going to the Olympics, Im sure I can get golfers that will do us proud,he stated.
translation.pcm: He tok say; If we fit reach Olympics, I dey sure say we get golfers wey go play well.

translation.en: Cult clashes: Man arrested over killing of cousin in Edo
translation.pcm: Cult Clash: Dem arrest one man for Edo say he kil hin cousin

translation.en: Operatives of the Edo State Police Command have arrested a man identified as Igboje Victor, for allegedly taking part in the killing of his cousin brother during a rival cult fight.
translation.pcm: Pipo wey dey operate for Edo State Police command don arrest one man wey hin name na Igboje Victor, bikos dem think say he get hand for di kilin of hin cousin brother wen two rival cult dey fight.

translation.en: Igboje was among the 54 suspects paraded by the Edo State Police Commissioner, Philip Aliyu Ogbadu, for involving in various crimes in the state.
translation.pcm: Igboje dey among di 54 suspect wey Edo state Police Commissioner parade, Phillips Aliyu Ogbadu, say dem dey various crime for di state.

translation.en: According to the commissioner, the suspects were arrested for armed robbery, kidnapping, murder, cultism, rape among others.
translation.pcm: As per wetin di Comissioner tok, dey arrest di suspect for armed robbery, kidnappin, murder, cultism, rape and oda tins.

translation.en: The incident, it was learnt, happened in Sabogida-Ora Opuje community Owan West local government of Edo State.
translation.pcm: Dey later know say di incident apun for Sabogida-Ora Opuje community for Owan west local goment for Edo state

translation.en: Im innocent
translation.pcm: I dey innocent

translation.en: In an interview with Daily Trust, Igboje denied involvement in the killing.
translation.pcm: For one interview wit Daily trust, Igboje deny say he get hand for di kilin

translation.en: I was not involved in the killing of my brother but was arrested because I am a member of Eiye cult group while my late brother is in Aiye group.
translation.pcm: I no get hand for my brother death but dem arrest me bikos I be Eiye cult group member while my late brother dey Aiye group.

translation.en: In our community, we used to sell Indian Hemp to make money but the Aiye group used the drug business to arrest Eiye members through the police.
translation.pcm: For awa community, we been dey sell Igbo take make moni, but Aiye group use di drug business use police arrest Eiye members.

translation.en: The leader of both group scheduled a meeting at night to resolve the issue,he said.
translation.pcm: He tok say di leader of di two group plan to meet dat night solve di gbege

translation.en: He however added that, on the day of the meeting, Aiye members laid an ambush and shot at Eiye members while on their way to the venue of the meeting, killing one of them who was later taken to the mortuary.
translation.pcm: He kom later add say, For di night of di meeting, Aiye members set trap for dem, dey kom shot Eiye members as dem dey go di meetin venue, dey kil one of dem wey dey later carry go mortuary.

translation.en: The brother of the deceased, who is a military officer, said they should go and bury the boy because of his mother
translation.pcm: Di pesin wey die brother na soldier, he say make dey go bury am bikos of hin mama.

translation.en: After the burial, I went to the neighbouring community to buy food but when I returned, I learnt that Eiye members had gone to attack an Aiye member who happened to be my cousin and he died as a result of the injury he sustained.
translation.pcm: Afta di burial,  I go di neighbourin community go buy food but wen I kom back, I hear say Eiye boys don go attack one Aiye guy and di guy na my cousin, he die bikos of di injury wey hin get

translation.en: He said he was not among the group that attacked his brother, adding because we belong to rival cult groups, they said I was the one that killed him
translation.pcm: He tok say he no dey for di group wey attack hin brother, he add say na bikos dem dey different group make dem tok say na hin kil am

translation.en: and I was arrested by police alongside others.
translation.pcm: And police kom arrest me wit di rest

translation.en: I was not even there when my brother was attacked.
translation.pcm: I no even dey der wen dey attack my brother

translation.en: I didnt kill my brother,he said.
translation.pcm: He tok say: I no kil my brother

translation.en: The commissioner of police, however, said the suspects would be charged to court as soon as the investigation is completed.
translation.pcm: Di commissioner of police kom tok say, dem go go court if dey don finish dia investigation

translation.en: Economic woes deepen as bakers hike bread, biscuits prices by 30%
translation.pcm: Economy kasala dey plenti as bakers increase bread and biscuit wit 30%

translation.en: Nigeria's economic woe worsens as most food item doubled in price over the weekend and the bikers decided to grace us with their 30% increase too on every item made with flour
translation.pcm: Economy kasala for Nigeria don worse as plenti food item don double dia price for di weekend and pipo wey dey bake sef join dem as dey add 30% for evritin wey dem dey use flour do.

translation.en: The economic hardship in the country has taken a new dimension as the Association of Master Bakers and Caterers of Nigeria (AMBCN) has directed its members to increase the prices of bread, biscuits and other baked items by 30 percent due to the rising cost of production.
translation.pcm: Di kontri economy wey hard don show face for anoda mata as di Association of Masters Bakers and Caterers of Nigeria (AMBCN) don tell dia members say make dem increase bread, biscuit and any oda tin wey dem dey bake price wit 30 percent bikos of di cost of production wey don high.

translation.en: Bread and biscuits are common consumable items in many Nigerian households and before the association gave this directive, many had lamented the sharp increase in cost of items across the country.
translation.pcm: Bread and biscuit na food wey common for plenti house for Nigeria, and before di association announce wetin dem tok, plenti pipo for di kontri don dey complain bikos of how tins cost.

translation.en: At the National Executive Council (NEC) meeting of the association held in Abuja recently, members lamented the cost of production and reached the resolution of raising prices.
translation.pcm: For di National Executive Council (NEC) meeting wey di association do for Abuja recently, dia members dey complain about how tins cost and dey gree say make dem increase di price of wetin dem dey sell.

translation.en: The national president of AMBCN, Mansur Umar, said the price adjustment was as a result of the sudden increase in the cost of production as well as prices of sugar, butter, yeast and flour.
translation.pcm: AMBCN national president, Mansur Umar, tok say di price wey dem change na bikos of  di way wey cost of production take increase suddenly and how sugar, butter, yeast and flour moni sef increase

translation.en: While commending the federal government for resuscitating the cassava flour programme, the association bemoaned the skyrocketing price of regular flour in the last six months with one truck of flour which cost less than N6 million is now N9m.
translation.pcm: As dem dey commend federal goment say dey revive di cassava flour programme, di association dey complain bad bad about regular flour price wey just increase anyhow since di last six month, wey be say one flour truck no reach 6 million before kom be 9 million now.

translation.en: After considering the impact of the skyrocketed prices of baking ingredients/materials for the survival of our noble business, which is presently bleeding, the association came to the conclusion to adjust our prices by 30 percent,he said.
translation.pcm: He tok say; afta we consider di bakin/ingredient and material price wey don too increase, sake of say make dis awa noble work wey dey bleed fit survive, di association conclude say make we just increase awa price wit 30 percent

translation.en: The association also resolved to ask the federal government to reverse the tariff regime imposed by the National Agency for Food and Drugs Administration and Control (NAFDAC) and to streamline bakers regulation by NAFDAC only.
translation.pcm: Di association sef conclude say dem go ask federal goment make dem reverse di tariff regime wey National Agency for Food Administration and Control (NAFDAC) force dem dey pay and make only NAFDAC dey steamline bakers regulation.

translation.en: Also speaking, the national secretary, Jude Okafor, was hopeful that the federal government will meet their demands to avert the increase.
translation.pcm: Dia national secretary , Jude Okafor wey tok sef say he dey hope say feredal goment do wetin dey want so dem go fit avoid di moni wey dey wan increase.

translation.en: DTigers draw kenya, Mali, Cote dIvoire for 2021 Afrobasket
translation.pcm: Tigers follow Kenya, Mali, Cote d'Ivoire for 2021 Afrobasket.

translation.en: Nigeria's senior male basketball team once again prove that they are from the giant of Africa as they nabbed the Highest rank African team title at the Olympics.
translation.pcm: Nigeria senior male basketball team don prove say na from Giant of Africa dey take kom as dey collect Highest rank African team title for Olympics.

translation.en: Nigerias senior male basketball team, DTigers have been drawn against Kenya, Mali and Cote dIvoire in the group stage of the 2021 FIBA Afrobasket.
translation.pcm: Nigeria senior male basketball team don follow Kenya, Mali and Cote d'Ivoire draw for di group stage for 2021 FIBA Afrobasket.

translation.en: At yesterdays brief ceremony, the 2015 Afrobasket champions landed in group C for the tournament to be held between 24th, August and 5th, September.
translation.pcm: For di cermony wey dem do yesterday briefly, di 2015 Afrobasket champion land for Group C for di tournament wey dem go do between August 24 and September 5.

translation.en: With many already tipping the DTigers as one of the title contenders, Nigeria will still face Cote dIvoire (ranked 50), 77th ranked Mali and Coach Liz Mills inspired Kenya who pulled off an upset against Angola with a buzzer beater to qualify after 28 years wait.
translation.pcm: As many pipo don dey tok say Tigers na strong team wey fit win di title, Nigeria go still face Cote d'Ivoire wey dey number 50 for rank, Mali wey be number 77 and Kenya wey beat Angola anyhow afta dey don wait 28 years bikos of dia Coach Liz Mills.

translation.en: The 2021 Tokyo Olympics bound team will hope to go a step further than their 2017 achievement where they won the silver medal.
translation.pcm: Di team wey go go Tokyo Olypmics for 2021, go nid play well pass wetin dey play for 2017 wen dey win Silver medal.

translation.en: The team who lost to host-Tunisia had since evolved to become number one in Africa and number 22 in the world.
translation.pcm: Di team lose to Tunisia wey dey host dat time and since dat time, dey be number one for Africa and number 22 for di world.

translation.en: DTigers in 2019 became the first country in the world to qualify for the FIBA World Cup.
translation.pcm: Tigers na hin be di first kontri wey go qualify for FIBA World Cup for 2019.

translation.en: Despite narrowly missing out of the quarter finals, the team were able to punch their Olympics ticket as the highest ranked team out of Africa at the tournament.
translation.pcm: Although e remain small wey dem go enta quarter finals, di team collect di Olympic ticket say na dem be di oga for Africa for di tournament.

translation.en: Illicit drugs: NDLEA uncovers N30bn slush funds
translation.pcm: Illicit drugs: NDLEA reveal N30bn unlawful moni.

translation.en: NDLEA hardworks pays off: The depth of illicit drugs trafficking and usage is uncovered in Nigeria as NDLEA has uncovered N30bn slush funds and drugs worth over N90bn
translation.pcm: NDLEA work don pay: Drug traffickin and de rate wey dem dey use am don show as NDLEA don see N30bn illegal moni collect and N90bn illegal drug sef join.

translation.en: The chairman of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, Buba Marwa, says the NDLEA is currently investigating N30bn slush funds believed to be proceeds of drugs.
translation.pcm: National Drug Law Enforcement Agency Chairman, Buba Marwa, tok say NDLEA dey investigate N30bn slush fund wey dem feel say na moni for drugs.

translation.en: He disclosed this in Abuja on Monday while giving commendation letters to 45 outstanding officers as well as best performing commands award for the months of March and April, 2021.
translation.pcm: He tok am for Abuja on Monday mornin wen hin give 45 officers wey dey work well commendation letter and best performing command award for March and April, 2021.

translation.en: He said the agencys offensive action would not stop until the nations streets, communities, towns and cities had been cleaned up of any remnant of illicit drugs.
translation.pcm: He tok say di strong action wey di agency dey take no go stop until  all di street,community, town and city wey dey di kontri no get drugs wey dey illegal again

translation.en: He said: While we keep up the offensive in the field, the leadership of the agency will daily continue to work out effective strategies and tactics to sustain the momentum.
translation.pcm: He tok say: As we continue to dey fight how dem dey use illegal drugs for outside, awa leaders for di agency go dey find how dem go maintain di situation.

translation.en: That is why weve strengthened our Directorate of Assets and Financial Investigations to go after all assets or funds linked to drug trafficking which had led to interim and final forfeiture orders on assets and funds worth billions of naira linked to drug traffickers and barons.
translation.pcm: Na di reaseon why we don make awa Directorate of asset and Finanacial Investigations, go make sure say dem collect all di moni and property wey get link wit drug traffickin, wey lead dem go meet di pipo dem and final order to forfeit property and moni wey worth plenti billion naira wey get link wit di pipo wey dey traffick di drugs and dia baron dem.

translation.en: Marwa said the vigour with which the agency was targeting drug cartels had led to the seizure of 2,050,766.33kg of assorted illicit drugs and cash worth over N90bn as well as arrest of 2,175 drug traffickers.
translation.pcm: Marwa tok say di strength wey di agency dey use target drug cartel don make dem fit seize different illegal drug wey reach 2,050,766.33kg, moni wey reach N90bn and dey don arrest 2,175 pipo wey dey carry di drug.

translation.en: He stressed the need to deny criminal elements all benefits of their proceeds of crime in addition to sending them to jail.
translation.pcm: He emphasize on top di fact say e dey important make di criminals dem no go fit collect any moni wey dem get from dia drugs dey go still kom go jail.

translation.en: Vigilantes arrest 2 kidnappers in Zaria
translation.pcm: Vigilante arrest 2 kidnappers for Zaria

translation.en: The matter of Kidnapping in Zaria and the country as a whole is now turning to a nightmare
translation.pcm: kidnappin mata for Zaria and whole kontri don dey worse.

translation.en: Two suspected kidnappers have been arrested by vigilantes at the Low-Cost area of Zaria in Kaduna State, Daily Trust reports.
translation.pcm: Daily trust tok say vigilante don arrest two pipo wey dem suspect say be kidnapper for one ghetto area for Zaria, Kaduna State.

translation.en: The incident occurred around 10 pm on Sunday when an unspecified number of kidnappers stormed the low-cost in an attempt to kidnap the residents but were confronted by the local vigilantes.
translation.pcm: Di incident apun around 10 on Sunday wen some kidnappers enta di place wit force say dey wan kidnap pipo wey dey stay for der but local vigilante face dem.

translation.en: A resident, who did not want to be named, said the kidnappers were shooting sporadically to scare the people but the vigilantes engaged them in a gun duel before the arrival of the police.
translation.pcm: One pesin wey dey stay der wey no wan tok hin name, tok say di kidnappers dey shoot anyhow to make pipo fear but di vigilante face dem wit dia gun before police kom later.

translation.en: Daily Trust however gathered that four residents were abducted by the other members of the kidnap gang while some youths sustained injuries in the encounter that lasted for about two hours.
translation.pcm: Daily trust later find out say some of di kidnappers dem kidnap four pipo wey dey der as some youth injure diasef for wen e apun, di kidnappin last for about two hours.

translation.en: Kaduna State Police Command spokesman ASP Mohammed Jalige said the two arrested suspects were undergoing interrogation while their fleeing accomplices were being trailed by the police.
translation.pcm: Kaduna State Police Command Spokeman ASP Muhammad Jalige tok say dem dey interrogate di two pipo wey dem arrest and police dey find di oda ones wey run.

translation.en: Interrogating IPOBs Emma Powerful threat to spill blood
translation.pcm: IPOB Emma Powerful don threaten pipo say he go spill blood.

translation.en: IPOB leader has threatened to turn the country to a zone riddled with bloodbath for people that don't see reason with him
translation.pcm: IPOB leader don threaten pipo say hin go dey kil pipo wey no reason wit am

translation.en: The threat to murder in cold-blood by one Emma Powerful, media and publicity secretary of the Indigenous Peoples of Biafra (IPOB) of any Igbo who neglects his warning is certainly going too far and should not be ignored, except we have finally descended into anarchy, where the powerful  as the little fascist, Mr. Emma Powerful as he called himself  can drag people out for merely disagreeing with him or his organization and have them dispatched to their ancestor as he boasted.
translation.pcm: Emma Powerful wey be media and publicity secretary for IPOB threat to dey kil any Igbo pesin wey no follow hin warning don dey too serious, and dey no suppose ignore am except say we no get goment, wer small small fascist like Mr Emma Powerful as he call himsef go dey tok say hin go dey drag pipo kom out, dey send dem go meet Baba God as he tok bikos dey no follow am or hin organization.

translation.en: He did not seem to boast empty; as the mayhem that is enveloping the South East region of Nigeria is obviously orchestrated.
translation.pcm: Di mouth wey hin dey run no be play; as e be say di kasala for Nigeria South-east show say na plan dey plan am.

translation.en: Bereft of the understandingg of the simple Igbo leadership etiquette, where a leader is Onye-oje ozi,or servant of his people who builds consensus through extensive consultation, the Emma Powerful who prefer a thuggish title of Onye-ike,whose basic instrument is coercion, intimidation and now threat to murder the same Ndigbo, who he claim to champion their cause.
translation.pcm: As he no understand how simple Igbo leadership dey be, wey be say dia leader na Onye-oje ozi or servant of hin pipo, wey make di pipo agree wit am afta he don consult plenti pipo, Emma Powerful wey prefer one thug title, Onye-ike, wey be say na to dey force dem, make dem fear am and now he dey threaten to kil di same Ndigbo wey he say he dey fight for.

translation.en: For a man so intolerant and wired to effortlessly shed blood to advance his cause, the question is who would really want to live in a Cave Republic run by bloody thugs.
translation.pcm: For man wey be say he no dey tolarate, wey be say to kil pipo take push hin cause no be kasala, di question be say who go wan stay tru tru for Cave Republic wey be say na thug dey run am

translation.en: The historical Biafra was not a choice made by Ndigbo; it was rather the only available option forced on Ndigbo at the time at a particular time in history, which they braved out with enormous heroism and sacrifice to defend and uphold.
translation.pcm: Di Biafra wey pipo know for history no be Ndigbo choice; Na di only choice wey dem force Ndigbo do be dat for dat time, wey dem face bravely wit plenti courage and sacrifice so dem go fit defend and uphold

translation.en: Biafra was not so much rebellion as it was a resistance to affirm the right of a people   not only to exist but to live in dignity.
translation.pcm: Biafra no too oppose authority reach how dey try make di pipo right dey valid, no be say make dem just exist, but na to live wit dignity.

translation.en: The historical Biafra was a line of safety drawn so that all of the Igbo people  then, brutally persecuted  who crossed into, can live in relative safety.
translation.pcm: Di Biafra wey dey history na like safety precaution for all Igbo pipo wey suppose don too suffer dat time fit kom, place wey dey fit stay safely.

translation.en: The declaration and the struggle of the historical Biafra was not a show piece or a profit-making enterprise for which the current purveyors are curiously engaged in.
translation.pcm: Di declaration and di struggle of di old Biafra no be show or avenue to make moni wey di pipo wey dey lead am dey do pass now.

translation.en: Prior to the declaration of Biafra in 1967, the Eastern consultative assembly, a formidable representative and consultative body of all shades of opinions in the eastern region, given the circumstances of the time unanimously agreed and gave their authority to the declaration.
translation.pcm: Before dem declare Biafra for 1967, Eastern Consultative assembly, one group wey dey represent, still dey advice for all di opinion wey pipo get for east, bikos of wetin dey apun gree say make dem make di declaration wit dia authority.

translation.en: And that was why the war to defend the young republic was a widely shared enterprise of Ndigbo and even other non-Igbo ethnic nationalities in the region, who made unforgettable sacrifices.
translation.pcm: Na di reason wey make di whole Ndigbo and oda tribe wey no be Igbo, wey sacrifice, wey dem no fit forget gree protect di republic wey still small

translation.en: Even as the war ended, with the collapse of Biafra, and national reconciliation, Ndigbo returned to project Nigeria without malice and with considerable determination and courage, to enable it work.
translation.pcm: As di war dey end sef, wey Biafra don fall, wey evribodi don settle, Ndigbo go back go protect Nigeria, wit clean mind, strong determination and courage, so e go fit work,

translation.en: The context of contemporary Nigerias crises and deepening fissures is on account of a neo-capitalist state hobbled by the backwardness and fetter of the productive forces, shackled and unable to reproduce the material basis for its existence.
translation.pcm: Di context of new Nigeria kasala and disagreement for dia point of view wey dey deep na bikos of one neo-capitalist state wey dey go backward, and di chain of di productive forces, wey dem chain, wey no fit produce di material of hin existence again.

translation.en: As the contemporary Nigerias state grows hollow and enters a melting point of atrophy and lethargy, the basic units consisting of ethnic nationalities and other civic, cultural and religious entities struggle for a space of self-preservation, expression and recreation.
translation.pcm: As di new Nigeria kasala dey grow, wey e no dey progress and e slow, di simple tins like tribe, culture and religion dey struggle to preserve, express and recreate diasef.

translation.en: In the overall, it is easier to brandish a secessionist flag, without an iota of understandingg of the critical socio-economic infrastructure on which a viable state can be constructed.
translation.pcm: ova-all, e dey easy to carry retirement flag, wen dey no understand how socio-economic infrastructure dey important if dey wan build kontri wey go survive.

translation.en: Africas newest state, South Sudan is still tragically in the intensive care unit, leaving the larger number of her population in worse condition than the earlier condition before a brand new state was created.
translation.pcm: South Sudan wey be Africa last born still dey breastfeed as dia condition now worse pass dia former condition.

translation.en: There is nothing to indicate that the current loud canvasser of Biafra has any insight into what a state establishment and construction is all about.
translation.pcm: Notin show say Biafra current leader wey like to dey make noise know anythin about how dem dey build or create kontri

translation.en: Even as the independent state, the yearn for are not in insight, the authoritarian and fascist streak of its purveyors like the threat of the Emma powerful that whoever disagrees with him would be dispatched to meet his ancestors are already evident.
translation.pcm: Even if dem dey independent, to built state no dey di real deal, to dey command pipo witout respect , make di fascist leaders like Emma Powerful wey dey threaten to kil pipo don show already.

translation.en: Ndigbo is quite sophisticated to be led by thugs and touts, who lack the simple understandingg that Igbo political culture and framework is basically consultative.
translation.pcm: Ndigbo too posh to get leaders wey be thug and tout, wey no understand say Igbo political culture and framework na to dey consult elders.

translation.en: The little dictator Mr. Nnamdi Kanu, who does not know any village in Igboland, besides his own, claims the leadership of Igbo nation as entitlement, a people, whose lives he hardly understood, except for the inflow of donations from its diaspora.
translation.pcm: Mr Nnamdi Kanu wey been dey command dem, no know any village for Igboland apart from hin own, dey claim to be dia leader like say na hin own, pipo wey be say he no know how dem dey live except for di moni wey hin dey send give dem from abroad.

translation.en: The media and publicity secretary, Mr. Emma, the Powerful through arrogance and petty fascist impunity has done more damage to the Igbo basic framework of consultation and consensus.
translation.pcm: Mr Emma "di Powerful" wey be dia media and publicity secretary don use hin arrogance and petty fascist inpunity spoil Igbo basic framework wey be say na to dey consult pipo and to dey agree for somethin generally before dey do am.

translation.en: Only a thuggish organization issues threats of murder and destruction to those who disagree with it.
translation.pcm: Na only organisation wey thug full dey threaten to destroy pipo wey no gree wit am.

translation.en: But this latest threat issued by Mr. Emma, de powerful to dispatch to ancestors; Ndigbo who refused to fall in line with him, is going too far.
translation.pcm: But dis new threat wey Mr Emma "de Powerful" issue say he go send pipo go meet dia forefathers sake of say dem no follow am, don too much.

translation.en: I can only imagine what the men who lowered down the Union Jack  to hoist up in its place hope symbolized in Green-White-Green drapery that early morning of October 1st 1960  felt.
translation.pcm: I been dey imagine wetin di men wey bring Union Jack down, kom use Green-white-Green cloth replace am, di cloth wey be symbol for hope for dat early morning for october first 1960

translation.en: It must have been something like the overwhelming dream logic of the marines who planted the American flag on Okinawa in 1945.
translation.pcm: E for don be like di great dream logic of di marine wey plant di America flag for Okinawa for 1945

translation.en: Oftentimes, I dream about being one of them.
translation.pcm: sometimes, I been dey dream say I be one of dem

translation.en: I would fantasize being one of them and then going home after the ceremony basking in the apotheotic glow of freedom and the blank canvass placed before my very own means.
translation.pcm: I go dey imagine say I be like dem and den if I reach house afta di ceremony, as my mind dey sweet me bikos of freedom and di blank canvass put before my veri own means.

translation.en: I would go to bed, to nirvana, and wait for the morning so I can wake up and go to work.
translation.pcm: I go go bed, go nirvana, go wait for morning so I go fit wake for mornin, go work.

translation.en: It is now sixty years since then.
translation.pcm: E don reach sixty years since dat time

translation.en: Even though I am only 30 years, I have lived in the nightmare of Nigerian history for every single year in this sixty-year journey and I have felt every disillusionment, every anguish that is to be felt over the failure of my country.
translation.pcm: Even though say na only 30 years I be, I don live for di bad dream of Nigeria history for all di year one by one for dis sixty year journey, I don feel evri disappointment and evri sorrow wey pesin fit feel bikos say dia kontri fail.

translation.en: It has been sixty years nowâ€¦ and all my dreams have left me  some have died, of the ravishing drought that followed in this abundantly watered land.
translation.pcm: E don reach sixty years now wey all my dream leave, some die, bikos ravishin drought wey follow dis land wey get plenti water .

translation.en: Others have flown out.
translation.pcm: Odas don fly comot

translation.en: What happened to us?
translation.pcm: wetin do us?

translation.en: I remember an artwork I saw on the internet reading something about the so-called Age of Discovery.
translation.pcm: I remember one artwork wey dey tok about sometin like "Age of Discovery" for Internet wey I see.

translation.en: In it, a man stood over another man was ostensibly sitting up from a hammock.
translation.pcm: Inside,one man stand ova anoda man wey sidan for hammock wit power.

translation.en: This was supposed to be a representation of Amerigo Vespucci rousing the eponymous American continent to join the league of mankindas the last continent.
translation.pcm: Dis suppose Amerigo Vespucci representation as he dey wake America continent of dat time make dem join mankind league as di last continent.

translation.en: Growing up, my brothers and I did all the house chores during school holidays.
translation.pcm: Na me and my brodas dey do house work for holiday wen we dey grow up.

translation.en: I also remember pretending to fall back to sleep after Subh to avoid doing my own share of the chores and my brothers would bring fire and fury to my bed until I am on my feet, lest I shortchange them.
translation.pcm: Me sef remember wen I dey pretend say I go sleep back afta Subh so I no go do my house work and my brodas go kom vex wake me, make I no cheat dem.

translation.en: Unlike America, Africa has always been known since the dawn of timeâ€¦ indeed, she was the first to awaken, she was the one who woke up the rest yet remains the most unknown member of the family  maybe because she went back to sleep, and slept while her siblings worked to discover fire and invent the wheel.
translation.pcm: Unlike America, dey don know Africa since beginnin of time, Indeed, na she first wake, she wake di rest sef but na she dem no know pass for di family, maybe bikos she go sleep back wen her siblins go dey work take discover fire and wheel.

translation.en: People like Joseph Conrad thus called her the Dark Continent.
translation.pcm: Pipo like Joseph been call her Dark Continent

translation.en: Since then, Africa has had no favourable popular culture recognition beside the gory, putrid, wretched-of-the-earth stereotype that was enough to make a couple of American teenage band from the 80s felt compelled by moral duty to bless down the rains to quench her ravishing drought
translation.pcm: Since den, Africa no get any popular culture wey pipo know kom still accept apart from bloody, rooten and poor mindset wey reach to make one teenage band wey kom from America from di 80s feel say na dia moral duty to kos rain wey go stop  di drought wey wan carry dem go by force.

translation.en: otherwise she would die.
translation.pcm: Odawise she go die

translation.en: It did not get any more primeval than that  all she needed was rain, nature, the same thing their  own Neolithic progenitors needed to survive.
translation.pcm: E no dey ancient pass dat one, wetin she need na rain, nature, di same tin wey dia ancient forefathers sef need dat time.

translation.en: Was that what happened?
translation.pcm: Shey na wetin apun be dat?

translation.en: Did we sneak back to bed, after rousing the rest of the world?
translation.pcm: Shey we sneak go bed back, afta we wake di oda pipo for we world

translation.en: And did we yet again find our way back to sleep after being roused a second time?
translation.pcm: And shey we go sleep back afta dey wake us di second time?

translation.en: Who knew it would get so bad that Africa, together with Nigeria, would need to rely on charity from a couple of teenagers who probably did not even yet know their left from their right hands?
translation.pcm: Wu go know say Africa, togeda wit Nigeria go spoil so tey, dem go dey wait make some teenager wey no sure say dem no dia right from left dey give dem charity.

translation.en: Not I.
translation.pcm: No be me

translation.en: Was Conrad right?
translation.pcm: Shey Conrad correct?

translation.en: Do I have a duty to moral rectitude to surrender to truth, to his profile of my kind?
translation.pcm: Shey na my duty to dey tok truth sake of say I dey honest, to wetin hin think say my pipo dey do

translation.en: Do I fly out like the rest of my dreams?
translation.pcm: Shey make I fly go out like di rest of my dream?

translation.en: Maybe I should.
translation.pcm: Maybe make I do am.

translation.en: How did we get here?
translation.pcm: How we take reach der?

translation.en: We boarded a car with an engine, sound and sleek, that revved to life like the Ark of Noah as we set out in 1960.
translation.pcm: We enta one car wey get engine, di sound good and e dey sleek, e kom life like Noah Ark as we dey go for 1960

translation.en: We should be on a rocket ship today heading to Mars, instead we have sunken into the mud, in a jalopy with a pitiful whimper for an engine.
translation.pcm: We suppose dey rocket ship dey go Mars, instead na inside mud we sink put, for one Jalopy wey hin engine no good.

translation.en: Before my own gnashing eyes, the heart of darkness did become my home and my home became the other world  the antithesis of civilization, a place where mans vaunted intelligence and refinement are finally mocked by triumphant bestiality.
translation.pcm: Before awa eye wey don dey gnash, di heart of darkness kom be my home, and my home kom be "di oda world", di opposite of civilisation, place wia be say tin wey no reach man level dey yeye man intelligence wey dem dey use boast and dia grace.

translation.en: I had resisted Conrad for so long but as the sun has set and I am tired of fighting.
translation.pcm: I don resist Conrad for long time now and di sun don dey set, I don tire to dey fight

translation.en: I was ready to surrender; my situation resembled that of Chief Joseph of the Nez Perce native American tribe when he was subdued.
translation.pcm: I dey ready to surrender, my situation wan resemble di of Chief Joseph of Nez Perce native America wen dey subdue am

translation.en: I have read somewhere his sermon to this people after he had surrendered and could not help mouthing them to myself:
translation.pcm: I don read hin sermon for hin pipo afta he surrender somewia  and I no fit stop myself as I dey tok am

translation.en: Our chiefs are killed.
translation.pcm: Dey kil awa chiefs dem

translation.en: Looking Glass is dead.
translation.pcm: Lookin glass don die.

translation.en: Toohoolhoolzote is dead.
translation.pcm: Toohoolhoolzote don die

translation.en: The old men are all dead.
translation.pcm: All di old men don die

translation.en: It is the young men who say, Yes or No.
translation.pcm: Na di young men tok say, Yes or No

translation.en: He who led the young men [Olikut] is dead.
translation.pcm: Di pesin wey lead di young men (Olikut) don die

translation.en: It is cold and we have no blankets.
translation.pcm: E cold and we no get blanket

translation.en: The little children are freezing to death.
translation.pcm: Cold dey catch di small pikin dem die

translation.en: My people, some of them, have run away to the hills, and have no blankets, no food.
translation.pcm: My pipo, some of dem don run go hill, and dey no get food and blanket.

translation.en: No one knows where they are  perhaps freezing to death.
translation.pcm: Nobodi know wia dem dey, maybe cold wan catch dem die

translation.en: I want to have time to look for my children, and see how many of them I can find.
translation.pcm: I want get time look for my pikin dem and see how many of dem wey I fit find

translation.en: Maybe I shall find them among the dead.
translation.pcm: Maybe I go find dem among pipo wey die

translation.en: Hear me, my chiefs!
translation.pcm: Hear wetin I dey tok, my chiefs!

translation.en: I am tired.
translation.pcm: I don tire

translation.en: My heart is sick and sad.
translation.pcm: My heart no well, e no hapi join

translation.en: From where the sun now stands, I will fight no more forever.
translation.pcm: From wer di sun dey, I no go fight again foreva

translation.en: I had made up my mind to surrender with terms as dictated by my foes.
translation.pcm: I don decide for my mind say I go surrender, follow wetin my enemy tok

translation.en: I had decided to follow our dreams where they have been exiled to.
translation.pcm: I don decide to follow awa dreams dem go di exile wey dem dey

translation.en: I will join the mile-long queue at the American or British or Canadian embassies and fly away.
translation.pcm: I go join di queue wey dey long reach like one mile for America or Britain or Canada embassy kom fly go

translation.en: About three weeks after 1st October 2020 as I drove up from Dape, a ghetto settlement in Gwarimpa, I noticed something.
translation.pcm: Afte like three weeks afta October 1st 2020 as I dey drive from Dape, one ghetto area for Gwarhinpa, I notice sometin,

translation.en: Green-White-Green.
translation.pcm: Green-White-Green

translation.en: But in the middle where the two green meadows yielded to the white valley, three words sang a melody that would have meant utterly nothing to me before the breaking of the world:
translation.pcm: But for di middle wia di two green meadow wey leave space for di white valley, three word sing melody wey for no mean anytin to me before di world break.

translation.en: Now, who the hell put that there?
translation.pcm: Now who kom put dat thing for they?

translation.en: I was so heavy laden and to think that I would see this here of all places!
translation.pcm: I dey so heavy Ladena and to say i go see dis kind for here!

translation.en: This was a place with people who have a lot more face-value reasons than I to despair and this fact threw me off balance.
translation.pcm: Dis place nah d place wey people wey get plenty face-value dey reason than I despair and dis fact no make me dey balance.

translation.en: An epiphany was before my eyes.
translation.pcm: I kon realize wetin dey before me.

translation.en: I could fly away and mooch off the sweat of others.
translation.pcm: I fit fly and run away with oda people sweat.

translation.en: I could surrender and fight no more and my life would be that of consummate comfort.
translation.pcm: I fit surrender fighting and my life go kon dey comfortable.

translation.en: But here I am, and I can see that I will not stand alone
translation.pcm: But nah here I dey and I con see say I no fit stand alone.

translation.en: should I choose to stand.
translation.pcm: Shey make I stand alone

translation.en: I could fly away, live and then die.
translation.pcm: I fit fly, live and die.

translation.en: But here, before me, in the land of my ancestors, was the prospect of immortality.
translation.pcm: But na, here before me, on my ancestors land di aspect of not wanting to die.

translation.en: Here I can actually live a life full of event and excitement, of building and breaking; breaking records and barriers that have never been broken elsewhere and defeating despair.
translation.pcm: Here I fit live life wey go full of event and so so enjoyment, of building and breaking to record and d barriers wey pesin neva break anywhere and to dey live to defeat hopelessness.

translation.en: Where else can anyone defeat despair so completely than in the Heart of Darkness?
translation.pcm: Where people fit defeat hopelessness expect in d heart of darkness?

translation.en: Maybe I will die trying, but how can a man die better than by facing odds so fearful as the ones before me?
translation.pcm: Maybe I go die while trying, but how man go die better wen he dey face challenges wey dey fear pesin like d one wey I dey face?

translation.en: We dont have to build skyscrapers, or nuclear power stations or maglev trains  we will build the next best thing, and maybe Conrad will be the one wanting a piece of those.
translation.pcm: We no need to build skyscrapers, d station for nuclear power or maglev trains, Nah we go build d next best thing. Maybe Conrad fit want a piece of doz things.

translation.en: He has reached saturation, but we are only at ten percent.
translation.pcm: He don reach his highest satisfactions but we dey ten percent.

translation.en: We can rise and rise until lambs become lions and by the time the sun sets on my generation, I would be a fulfilled man.

translation.en: Officer who sneaked drugs, phones into prison nabbed in Kano
translation.pcm: Officer wey dey carry drugs and phones inside d prison nabbed Kano operative of Nigeria.

translation.en: Operatives of the Nigerian Correctional Service (NCoS) have nabbed one of their officers who reportedly sneaked in over 4.8kg of cannabis sativa and eight Android phones into the correctional facility in Kano.
translation.pcm: Correctional service (NCoS) don catch one of their officers who dey always carry hard drugs wey dey weight over 4.8kgs and eight big phones inside d correctional facility wey dey Kano

translation.en: There was an uproar at the correctional centre on Thursday after the prison wardens detected and seized the cannabis allegedly brought to some inmates on death row at Kurmawa prison.
translation.pcm: Yawa dey dI correctional centre on Thursday afta di warders wey dey di prison see and collect di hard drugs wey dem dey bring for d prisoner’s wey dey death row for kurmawa prison.

translation.en: The seizure, according to reports led to resistance and the uproar from the inmates, while authorities promised to investigate how the illicit drugs got into the facility.
translation.pcm: As per di report wey dem gather  wen di warder collect d hard drugs from d prisoners, d prisoners dey shout up and down and di authority don promise say dem go look into d matter wella  to know how doz things take enter di facility.

translation.en: The spokesperson of the NCoS in Kano state, Musbahu Lawal Kofar Nassarawa, confirmed to Daily Trust that one of their staff (name withheld) was nabbed for colluding with other dealers outside to sneak the seized items into the prison.
translation.pcm: Di person wey dey tok to di NCoS wey dey Kano, wey be Musbahu Lawal Kofar Nassarawa, tok to di daily trust say na one of dia staff (wey dem no tok hin name) na di person wey dey steal for d oda pipo wey dey outside to dey carry di hard drugs outside di prison

translation.en: He said, We have arrested one of our staff who connived with these people to bring in 4.8kgs of cannabis and eight android phones to some inmates on death row, and that was why we had uproar on Thursday after our operatives have seized it.
translation.pcm: He tok  say dem don arrest one of dia staff wey dey among di pipo wey dey carry di hard drugs wey reach 4.8kg and di eight  android phone go give di prisoners wey dey death row, say na di reason why yawa dey on Thursday afta dI police don collect ham.

translation.en: This staff who works in the facility was recruited just two years ago in 2019.
translation.pcm: He tok say dI staff wey dey among dem just get work for two years ago in 2019.

translation.en: We have already handed him over to National Drugs Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) for further action.
