translation.en: The political class is flawed.
translation.pcm: Di politicians get comma.

translation.en: But that is the reason a new generation of leaders must emerge and take the reins.
translation.pcm: But dat na di reason why new generation of leaders must come up and take kontrol.

translation.en: None but ourselves can free our minds.
translation.pcm: Nobodi fit free awa mind except us.

translation.en: Citizenship is a call to duty.
translation.pcm: Citizenship na call to duty.

translation.en: NIGERIA IS NOT A SCAM.
translation.pcm: NIGERIA NO BE SCAM.

translation.en: Why secession is not the Silver Bullet to Nigerias challenges
translation.pcm: Why separation no be di Silver Bullet to Nigeria challenges

translation.en: The principle of self-determination as enshrined in the UN charter and which our secessionists latch on to was enacted at a time many peoples of the world were under colonial yoke or other forms of domination by outside powers.
translation.pcm: Di principle of self-determination as e dey for di UN charter wey awa pipo wey wan separate hold-on to, take effect for a time wey many pipo for di world dey under colonial yoke or oda form of kontrol by outside power.

translation.en: The principle was to give fillip to independence and liberation movements in order for them to gain their freedom and determine their path of future development.
translation.pcm: Di principle na to give chance to independence and liberation movements so dem go fit gain dia freedom and determine dia path of future development.

translation.en: In our world today, this principle applies only to a handful of peoples as an overwhelming majority of the world are now free from colonial subjugation and self-governing.
translation.pcm: For di world wey we dey today, dis principle only apply to few pipo, becos majority of di world don dey free from colonial kontrol and sef-governing.

translation.en: Thus the principle of self-determination, which was enacted under the UN charter, will have to be amended to accommodate the demands of our secessionists because going by its intendment and wordings they hardly qualify.
translation.pcm: So dem go need adjust di principle of sef-determination, wey dem establish under di UN charter, so e go fit accommodate di demand of awa pipo wey wan separate, becos if we follow wetin dey dere, dem no qualify.

translation.en: First of all, they have to prove constructively and convincingly that the areas they purport to represent are under some form of subjugation and that they lack the basic freedoms that all peoples should enjoy as required under the UN charter.
translation.pcm: First of all, dem go need to prove carefully and convincingly say di area wey dem claim to represent dey under som form of kontrol, and say dem dey lack di basic freedom wey everibodi suppose enjoy as e dey di UN charter.

translation.en: And in the unlikely case of proving that, they will also have to convince the UN of the steps they have taken from the national (National Assembly), sub-regional (ECOWAS) and continental level (AU) to press their case.
translation.pcm: And for wia dem wan prove dat one, dem go need convince di UN on di steps wey dem don take, from di national (National Assembly), sub-regional (ECOWAS) and continental level (AU) to present dia case.

translation.en: And the UN will not just take their word for it.
translation.pcm: And di UN no go just take dia word laidat.

translation.en: There will be fact finding committees to determine whether indeed Nigeria as a country practises the basic requirements of democracy or not.
translation.pcm: Dem go get committee wey go confam di fact to know weda true-true, Nigeria as a kontri dey practise di basic requirement of demokracy or not.

translation.en: The case is even made trickier by the fact that those areas are neither disputed territories nor under any trusteeship requiring a UN referendum to either confer direct independence to them or ask them which of the competing powers they wished to join.
translation.pcm: Dem don even complicate di case wit di fact say dose areas no be area wey dem dey fight untop, and no be area wey dey under any trusteeship wey go need UN referendum to give dem direct independence or ask dem who dem wan join inside di pipo wey dey fight untop di place.

translation.en: If our secessionists cannot provide these basic requirements, the farthest their case could get within the UN system will predictably be the waste paper basket because the UN is not for frivolities.
translation.pcm: If our secessionists cannot provide these basic requirements, the farthest their case could get within the UN system will predictably be the waste paper basket because the UN is not for frivolities.

translation.en: It does not lend its very elaborate and transparent processes to be abused by movements that hardly know what they are about.
translation.pcm: E no dey give chance make som movement wey no know wetin dem dey about abuse im wide and transparent process.

translation.en: The case of marginalisation, which is also cited as one of the reasons for secession, is too trivial to even waste our time on.
translation.pcm: Di case of marginalisation, wey dem mention as part of di reason for separation, dey too simple to waste awa time untop.

translation.en: Every democratic system provides for winners and losers in elections.
translation.pcm: Na everi democratik system dey get winner and loser for election.

translation.en: And as imperfect as our political system is, the constitution compels mandatory representation in government and its institutions for as many ethnic nationalities and geo-political zones as possible.
translation.pcm: And as awa politikal system no perfect reach, di konstitution make am compulsory say as many ethnic group and geo-political zones as possible must get representative for government and im institutions.

translation.en: The secessionist would have a tough time convincing the outside world that their case for marginalisation is more compelling than those of the over 300 other ethnic nationalities inhabiting Nigeria.
translation.pcm: E go tough for di pipo wey wan separate to convince di outside world say dia case of marginalisation dey more compelling pass dat of more dan 300 oda ethnic group wey dey Nigeria.

translation.en: In other words, why would the international community, to which the secessionists address their grievances and from which they seek support for their cause, single out just two out of the hundreds of such cases ringing in the Nigerian media for action?
translation.pcm: Wetin dis one mean be say, why di international community, wey di pipo wey wan separate dey report and seek support from go single out jus two out of like hundred of dat kind case wey dey ring for di Nigerian media say na im dem go work on ?

translation.en: What makes their cases so special and urgent above those of others in Nigeria who have conversely chosen not to follow the path of secession?
translation.pcm: What makes their cases so special and urgent above those of others in Nigeria who have conversely chosen not to follow the path of secession?

translation.en: On all the three premises that our secessionists base their agitations, none is convincing or compelling enough to justify their actions.
translation.pcm: Out of all di three tins wey make awa secessionists dey agitate, no one dey convincing or compelling enough to justify dia action.

translation.en: On the amalgamation argument, Nigeria is not a unique case in Africa or indeed the world.
translation.pcm: On di amalgamation argument, Nigeria own no be special case for Afrika or for di world.

translation.en: If Nigeria has to be broken up because it was wrongly amalgamated by Britain, then this applies to virtually all but a few countries in Africa.
translation.pcm: If Nigeria go need break up unto say Britain no join am well, den dis go be di case of almost all di kontris for Afrika.

translation.en: In essence if this principle were to be applied it will set the course for the commencement of a new scramble for Africa by the old and emerging powers of the world in which Africans as before will be the victims.
translation.pcm: In short, if dem use dis principle, e go start di course to begin a new scramble for Africa by di old and upcoming world powers, and like befor, na Afrikans go be di victim.

translation.en: Let us not deceive ourselves for the disintegration of Nigeria if it happens (God forbid) will result in the emergence of entities
translation.pcm: Make we no deceive awasef, becos if di break-up of Nigeria happun (God forbid), e go lead to di birth of kontris

translation.en: too weak such that they will find themselves at the mercy of foreign powers.
translation.pcm: wey go dey weak sotey, dem go dey beg from di foreign powers.

translation.en: Some arguments have been made of a break up of Nigeria along the lines of Eastern European states and in the Balkans.
translation.pcm: We don get som argument wey dey compare di break up of Nigeria wit dat of Eastern European states and di Balkans.

translation.en: In this regard, it will serve us well to discern that what works for Europe may not necessarily work for Africa.
translation.pcm: Untop dis one, e go beta make we undastand well say di tin wey work for Europe fit no work for Africa.

translation.en: In the case of the aforementioned countries, it was part of great geo-strategic games of the major world powers who had direct cultural, economic and political links and interests in the emerging scenarios.
translation.pcm: In di case of di kontris wey we mention, na part of di great geo-strategic games of di major world powers wey get direct cultural, economik and politikal link and interest for di emerging scenario.

translation.en: And these countries had defined borders before they agreed to come together for mutual defence in the uncertain situation of the Second World War.
translation.pcm: And dis kontris don get clear boundary befor dem agree to kom togeda for mutual defence durin di uncertain situation of di Second World War.

translation.en: Once the Soviet order, which held them together, began to unravel the need arose for the peripheral countries to revert to the status quo ante.
translation.pcm: Immediately di Soviet order, wey join dem togeda begin dey scatter, all dis kontris need go back to di status quo ante.

translation.en: And, more importantly, these developments had the backing and guarantees of the principal powers in Europe and the world in the quest for a balance of power.
translation.pcm: And, more importantly, dis developments get di backing and guarantee of di important powers for Europe and di world.

translation.en: Do Nigerian secessionists have such reckoning and profile in the calculations of the principal powers of the world to warrant their time?
translation.pcm: Se Nigerian secessionists get dat kind recognition and profile in di face of di principal powers of di world wey go make dem answer dem?

translation.en: The answer obviously is zilch.
translation.pcm: Surely, di answer na zero.

translation.en: This is, however, not dismissing that the agitations for secession in the country do not have some justifiable basis.
translation.pcm: Dis no kom mean say di agitation of pipo to separate for di kontri no get som gud reason.

translation.en: Anybody living in this country with the rising case of insecurity, poverty, corruption, nepotism, economic uncertainties amidst the unbelievable incompetence and near criminal indifference of the government to these challenges will conclude that indeed we have a state that is failing in its basic constitutional duties and responsibilities.
translation.pcm: Anybodi wey dey live for dis kontri wit dis rising case of insecurity, poverty, corruption, nepotism, economic uncertainty and di unbelievable incompetence and near criminal indifference of di government to dis challenges go conclude say truly, we dey for a kontri wey dey fail for im basic konstitutional duties and responsibilities.

translation.en: And in a fragile country like ours with gaping fault lines, tendencies or preferences for dissolution of the union are bound to emerge and grow exponentially along with the clear dysfunctionality of the government of the day.
translation.pcm: And for a fragile kontri like awa own, wey get plenti fault, e dey normal for tendency or preference for separation to arise and grow fast wit di clear dysfunctionality of di government wey dey.

translation.en: And these feelings are all round.
translation.pcm: And na everybodi get dis dis feeling.

translation.en: But daunting as the outlook is and tempting as the prospect appears, secession cannot be the solution to our existential challenges as a nation.
translation.pcm: But as discouragin as di outlook be, and as temptin as di outcome dey appear, separation no fit be di solution to awa current challenge as a nation.

translation.en: Indeed it is a prospect fraught with lurking uncertain dangers not least for its proponents but for the country as a whole.
translation.pcm: Indeed na prospect wey get som unknown dangers, danger wey no be for di secessionists alone but for di kontri as a whole.

translation.en: Nigeria is not imperfect.
translation.pcm: Nigeria no dey perfect.

translation.en: Even some of the advanced countries have shown that despite years of existence and well defined systems, they are not immune from crises arising from internal contradictions.
translation.pcm: Even som of di advance kontris don show say despite dia years of existence and dia gud systems, dem no dey free from crises wey dey kom from internal conflict.

translation.en: We should not delude ourselves that in trying to break up our country, some countries will benevolently assist us.
translation.pcm: Make we no dey deceive awasef say as we dey try break up awa kontri, som kontris go graciously assist us.

translation.en: What they will do is provide us with the means to destroy and weaken ourselves in the process and then proceed to profit from that at our own expense.
translation.pcm: Wetin dem go do na to give us di means to destroy and weaken awasef, so dem go fit benefit while we go suffer am.

translation.en: That is the reality of the international system.
translation.pcm: Na di truth about di international system be dat.

translation.en: As the distinguished German beamter at the beginning of my article said and advised; we are at once our own problems and our own solutions.
translation.pcm: As di popular German beamter tok for di beginnin of my paper; Na we be awa own problem and solution join togeda.

translation.en: We must put our thoughts, talents and efforts collectively to developing Nigeria rather than breaking it up.
translation.pcm: We need put awa mind, talent and effort togeda to develop Nigeria instead say we wan breaking am.

translation.en: Fidelity marks Childrens Day with N9.3m cash gift to customers
translation.pcm: Fidelity celebrate Children Day wit N9.3m money gift to dia customers

translation.en: To mark this years Childrens Day, Fidelity Bank paid N150,000 to 62 Sweet Account (SWEETA) holders across the country amounting to a total of N9.3 million through its ongoing savings loyalty programme.
translation.pcm: To celebrate dis year Children Day, Fidelity Bank pay N150,000 to 62 pipo wey get Sweet Account (SWEETA) tru-out di kontri, wey be di total of N9.3 millionthroughdia savings loyalty programme wey dey go on.

translation.en: The bank presented cheques to the beneficiaries at various childrens events in Katsina, Niger, Abuja and Lagos.
translation.pcm: Di bank present cheque to di beneficiaries for different children events for Katsina, Niger, Abuja and Lagos.

translation.en: Commenting on the initiative, Fidelity Bank CEO, Mrs Nneka Onyeali-Ikpe, said, All-round quality education remains a strong anchor in raising tomorrows children and breeding exceptional children who can compete globally.
translation.pcm: About di initiative, Fidelity Bank CEO, Mrs Nneka Onyeali-Ikpe, tok say all-round quality education na im be di strong way to train di children of tomorrow and to train special children who go fit compete wit odas for di world.

translation.en: This is why we have decided to contribute our quota as a bank by offering school fees support to select Nigerian children.
translation.pcm: Na why we don decide to contribute awa own as a bank, by giving school fees support to selected Nigerian children.

translation.en: The bank has given out N4.1bn to 10,280 customers from the inception of the loyalty scheme to date.
translation.pcm: Di bank don dash out N4.1bn to 10,280 customers since dem start di loyalty programme till today.

translation.en: Investing in young people: The Ahmed Bobboi example
translation.pcm: Investin in young pipo: Ahmed Bobboi example

translation.en: In July, 2017, I had the singular honour of spending an evening inside a British bank called Coutts as part of the many activities lined up for us as the 2017 Queens Young Leaders.
translation.pcm: For July, 2017, I get di honour to spend one evenin inside one British bank wey dem dey call Coutts, as part of di plenti activity wey dey for us as di 2017 Queen's Young Leaders.

translation.en: You may wonder why I would be writing about attending an event in a place as boring as a bank.
translation.pcm: U fit dey wonder say why I go dey write about event wey I go for place wey dry like bank.

translation.en: However, Coutts is no ordinary bank.
translation.pcm: Anyway, Coutts no be ordinary bank.

translation.en: Apart from being one of the eight oldest banks in the world (founded some 329 years ago in 1692), Coutts is a private bank known for its high ranking clientele like Her Majesty the Queen.
translation.pcm: Apart from say na one of di eight oldest bank for di world (dem start am som 329 years ago for 1692), Coutts na private bank wey dey popular for im big customers like Her Majesty di Queen.

translation.en: Walking inside the vast hall, we were welcomed by two men under a great dome in the centre of the building.
translation.pcm: Inside di big hall, na two welcome us under a big dome for di centre of di building.

translation.en: I immediately recognised one of the two men who stood with a familiar wide smile.
translation.pcm: Na sharp-sharp I recognise one of di two men wey stand wit a familiar wide smile.

translation.en: It was Sir John Major, a former British Prime Minister and Chairman of the Queen Elizabeth Diamond Jubilee Trust.
translation.pcm: Na Sir John Major, befor-befor British Prime Minister and Chairman of di Queen Elizabeth Diamond Jubilee Trust.

translation.en: We had met earlier at a dinner in our honor in the Australian High Commission in London where he congratulated us for our recognition by Her Majesty.
translation.pcm: We don meet befor, for one dinner wey dem organize for us for di Australian High Commission wey dey London, and na dere e congratulate us for awa recognition by Her Majesty.

translation.en: The other man was introduced to us as Lord William Waldegrave of North Hill, Chairman of the Board of Coutts Bank and Chairman of the Royal Mint Advisory Committee.
translation.pcm: Dem introduce di oda man to us as Lord William Waldegrave of North Hill. Na im be di Chairman of di Board of Coutts Bank and Chairman of di Royal Mint Advisory Committee.

translation.en: We had a splendid evening full of entertainment; eating and drinking.
translation.pcm: Dat evening dey full of entertainment; eatin and drinkin. E sweet well-well

translation.en: But beyond the pomp and glamour were the speeches and interactions with Lord Waldegarve and Sir Major, two outstanding leaders in the United Kingdom (UK).
translation.pcm: But apart from di display and glamour, we tok and gist wit Lord Waldegarve and Sir Major, two outstandin leaders for di United Kingdom (UK).

translation.en: They expressed delight at celebrating our achievements and described us as extraordinary individuals, charging us to develop our skills even further and create lasting legacies for our countries and the Commonwealth at large.
translation.pcm: Dem show dia happiness to celebrate awa achievement, and dem describe us as special pipo. Dem encourage us to develop awa skills more and create long legacy for awa kontri and di Commonwealth togeda.

translation.en: Subsequently, I spoke privately to both Sir Major and Lord Wadegrave, asking them specific questions ranging from public service to banking and finance to innovation and young people.
translation.pcm: Afta, I follow Sir Major and Lord Wadegrave yarn for private, I ask dem som question about public service, banking and finance, innovation and young pipo generally.

translation.en: I learned immensely from them
translation.pcm: I learn a lot of tins from dem

translation.en: and I left Coutts
translation.pcm: and I komot for Coutts.

translation.en: that night tremendously inspired and motivated to be an even more active change agent, innovator and young leader back in Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Dat night seriously inspire and motivate me more as a change agent, innovator and young leader for Nigeria.

translation.en: Whether you are in government or in business, and especially as an innovator or entrepreneur, I cannot overemphasise how crucial these types of inspirations can be for the work you do.
translation.pcm: Weda u dey for government, or u dey business, and especially as innovator or entrepreneur, I no fit tok am finish, how important dis kind inspiration fit be for di work wey u dey do.

translation.en: Some may write off these validations as irrelevant, forgetting how instances like such provide a great deal of mentorship, motivation, as well as create examples for aspiring leaders to see champions among people like themselves.
translation.pcm: Som pipo fit komot face for dis confirmation say e no dey relevant. Dem don forget how dis kind tok fit be beta way of mentorship and motivation for upcomin leaders, and e fit serve as example for dem to see champions among pipo wey be like dem.

translation.en: The feeling of validation and motivation coupled with guidance and support is an absolutely necessary ingredient for all leaders and especially young people.
translation.pcm: Di feeling of validation and motivation, wit guidance and support na necessary ingredient for everi leader, especially young pipo.

translation.en: The earlier our older generation in Nigeria realises it and wholeheartedly embraces this culture of support, mentorship and indeed celebration of our achievements, the better for the future of this country and its burgeoning population of young people.
translation.pcm: Di earlier awa older generation for Nigeria realise and accept dis culture of support and mentorship wit dia full chest, and truly celebrate awa achievements, di beta e go be for di future of dis kontri and di growin population of young pipo.

translation.en: Forgive my digression.
translation.pcm: Make u forgive my digression.

translation.en: The reason I am narrating this encounter is that for a long time since it happened, I did not quite experience anything like it until recently when I sat with another public servant in Nigeria, the Executive Secretary of the Petroleum Equalisation Fund
translation.pcm: Di reason why I dey narrate dis experience na say, since wey e don happun, I no experience dat kind tin again, until recently wen I siddun wit anoda public servant for Nigeria, di Executive Secretary of di Petroleum Equalisation Fund

translation.en: (Management) Board (PEF-M-B), Alhaji Ahmed A Bobboi.
translation.pcm: (Management) Board (PEF-M-B), Alhaji Ahmed A Bobboi.

translation.en: Whereas oil and gas is not my main industry of discipline or practice, I am of the firm opinion that not being knowledgeable about it is very reckless since the sectors revenue contribution
translation.pcm: Even say oil and gas no be my main industry of discipline or practice, I get strong opinion say make pesin no sabi am dey very careless since di contribution of di sector to revenue

translation.en: far outweighs any non-oil revenue source to the country.
translation.pcm: pass any oda sector for di kontri.

translation.en: So I have kept myself abreast of the industry even as I advocate for a transition and dedication to non-oil sources of income.
translation.pcm: So I don dey try sabi wetin dey happun for di industry, even say I want make we shift and focus on non-oil sources of income.

translation.en: I was delighted by the opportunity to engage with a crucial stakeholder in the person of the executive, especially because the organisation is a pacesetter in deploying cutting edge technology to improve efficiency and performance in the sector.
translation.pcm: I dey happy say I get di opportunity to yarn wit a crucial stakeholder like di executive, especially becos di organisation na pacesetter for di use of advance technology to improve efficiency and performance for di sector.

translation.en: However, what I got from this encounter was even more valuable than just further understanding of the industry.
translation.pcm: Howeva, wetin I gain from dis experience even dey more valuable pass my understanding of di industry more.

translation.en: We discussed on topics ranging from history to governance and from job creation to innovation and entrepreneurship.
translation.pcm: We discuss difrent topic; from history to government, and from job creation to innovation and entrepreneurship.

translation.en: It was so exhilarating and refreshing and it transported me directly to Coutts once again.
translation.pcm: E dey very excitin and refreshin, and e carry me straight go Coutts again.

translation.en: I had met Mr Bobboi for the first time when I joined a team which he co-champions, working on a regional entrepreneurship acceleration programme under the auspices of Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) where communities around the world engage with MIT in an evidence-based practical approach to strengthening innovation-driven entrepreneurial ecosystems.
translation.pcm: I meet Mr Bobboi for di first time wen I join one team wey e follow kontrol, we dey work untop one regional entrepreneurship acceleration programme under di supervision of Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) wia different community for di world join MIT for evidence-based practical approach to make di entrepreneurial ecosystems strongthroughinnovation.

translation.en: I was immediately struck by the vision and dedication that this spells for PEF-M-B to be involved in this project as it is certainly visionary and more beneficial to help build a formidable entrepreneurial ecosystem with a partner like MIT than the usually mundane and often barely impactful Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) programmes most institutions engage in.
translation.pcm: I dey suprised by di vision and dedication wey dis go bring for PEF-M-B to dey involve for dis project, as e surely dey visionary and more beneficial to help build a formidable entrepreneurial ecosystem wit partner like MIT pass di ordinary Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) programme wey most organization dey do, wey no dey get impact most times.

translation.en: During that particular encounter with him, we discussed about our two-year programme with MIT and the huge burden of truly accelerating entrepreneurial development as a remedy to lack of jobs and a catalyst for prosperity.
translation.pcm: For dat particular encounter wey I get wit am, we yarn about awa two-years programme wit MIT and di big responsibility of truly acceleratin entrepreneurial development as remedy to lack of jobs and catalyst for prosperity.

translation.en: The He spoke about various pain points for him as a leader and the approach to solve them.
translation.pcm: The He spoke about various pain points for him as a leader and the approach to solve them.

translation.en: One of my most brilliant takeaways was his idea on the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) and how it could be hacked to serve young graduates and the nation better.
translation.pcm: One of di wonderful takeaway wey I collect na im idea about di National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) and how we fit use am serve young graduates and di nation beta.

translation.en: Noticing the idleness of some of the corps members serving at PEF-M-B, the executive secretary said he had been devising ways of not only ensuring that they were engaged, but that they left with lasting skills and knowledge that would inform career paths for them beyond government jobs.
translation.pcm: Becos e don dey notice say som corps members wey dey serve for PEF-M-B dey always dey idle, di executive secretary tok say e don dey find way to ensure say di corp members no just dey engaged, but say dem komot wit skills and knowledge wey go last, and wey go give dem career wey pass government job.

translation.en: This includes an elaborate programme to turn them into innovation-driven entrepreneurs through a dedicated and well curated innovation and enterprise training during their service year at PEF-MB.
translation.pcm: Part of dis go be to do one big programme wey go turn dem to entrepreneurs wey get passion for innovation,througha dedicated and well planned innovation and enterprise trainin durin dia service year for PEF-MB.

translation.en: The ingenuity and candid disposition of Mr. Bobboi was apparent and permeated throughout our discussion and I was left with an equally firm will to do my best in not only continually innovating across sectors but also ensuring continuity in cascading the inspiration and support for younger leaders and innovators, which could make all the difference for our dear country Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Di honesty and sincere disposition of Mr. Bobboi dey visible and penetrating truout awa discussion and me sef kom get di strong will to do my best, no be only to kontinue dey innovate for different sector but to also dey ensure kontinuity for di inspiration and support of younger leaders and innovators, wey go fit make all di difference for awa dear kontri Nigeria.

translation.en: Lagos LG polls: Aspirants to face direct primary as consensus option fails
translation.pcm: Lagos LG polls: Aspirants go face direct primary as consensus option don fail

translation.en: Ahead of the July local government election in Lagos State, the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) will conduct an open primary for aspirants in the 20 local government areas (LGs) and 37 local council development areas (LCDAs), Daily Trust can report.
translation.pcm: In preparation of di July local government election for Lagos State, di rulin All Progressives Congress (APC) go conduct open primary for aspirants wey dey di 20 local government areas (LGs) and 37 local council development areas (LCDAs), Daily Trust report.

translation.en: It was, however, learnt that there are some local governments where consensus option had been agreed upon.
translation.pcm: Howeva, we hear say som local governments dey wia dem don agree to use di consensus option.

translation.en: Our correspondent gathered yesterday that the resort to the open primary followed the inability of aspirants to step down for one another amidst tension and disquiet among the LG chapters.
translation.pcm: Awa tori-pesin hear am yesterday say di decision to use open primary na becos di aspirants no gree step down for demsef, plus di tension and unrest wey dey among di LG chapters.

translation.en: It would be recalled that 1050 aspirants comprising 250 chairmanship and 800 councillorship aspirants are vying for the 434 positions in the 57 LGs.
translation.pcm: We go rememba say 1050 aspirants wey be di combination of 250 chairmanship and 800 councillorship aspirant dey contest for di 434 positions wey dey di 57 LGs.

translation.en: The party had been in a fix over a large number of aspirants while setting up a screening committee headed by the Deputy Governor, Dr Obafemi Hamza.
translation.pcm: Di party don dey for confusion untop plenti aspirants, as dem dey set up screening committee wey  go dey unda di supervision of di Deputy Governor, Dr Obafemi Hamza.

translation.en: As of the time of filing this report, aspirants were anxiously awaiting the result of the screening.
translation.pcm: As at wen we dey write dis report, aspirants dey wait anxiously for di result of di screenin.

translation.en: A local government chairman who is contesting for a second term in a chat with our correspondent said an open primary would take place on Saturday, May 29, 2021, saying he is ready to face two other aspirants challenging him to the ticket.
translation.pcm: One local government chairman wey dey contest for second term, yarn wit awa tori-pesin for chat, e tok say open primary go happun on Saturday, May 29, 2021, and say im dey ready to face two oda aspirants wey dey challenge am for di ticket.

translation.en: Daily Trust reports that the party had already issued guidelines to the aspirants ahead of the open primary in a local government where consensus could not be agreed upon.
translation.pcm: Daily Trust make us know say di party don already give di aspirants guideline befor di open primary wey go happun for local government wia consensus no fit happun.

translation.en: According to the guidelines sighted by Daily Trust, Accredited members shall vote by open ballot at the designated venue by queuing up in front of the poster of their preferred candidate and
translation.pcm: As e dey for di guideline wey Daily Trust see, Accredited members go use open ballot vote for di venue, dem go stand for front of di poster of di candidate wey dem like, and

translation.en: the aspirant with the highest number of votes shall be announced as the winner accordingly.
translation.pcm: di candidate wey get di highest numba of votes na im dem go announce as di winner.

translation.en: Following the widespread report about the endorsement of some candidates by the APC National Leader and strongman of Lagos politics, Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu, the former governor had come out to debunk the claim, saying he has no preferred candidate.
translation.pcm: Afta di popular report say di APC National Leader and strongman for Lagos politics, Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu don endorse som candidate, di former governor don deny di claim, say im no get candidate wey im prefer.

translation.en: In a chat with Daily Trust, the Publicity Secretary of the state Caretaker Committee, Seye Oladejo said, The guidelines are explicit that open direct primaries should be conducted.
translation.pcm: For one chat wit Daily Trust, di Publicity Secretary of di state Caretaker Committee, Seye Oladejo tok say, di guidelines dey clear, say na open direct primary make dem do.

translation.en: The party is irrevocably committed to internal democracy and provide a level playing ground for all aspirants.
translation.pcm: Di party dey strongly committed to internal demokracy and dem provide a level playin ground for all aspirants.

translation.en: UK MPS Demand Boycott of 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics
translation.pcm: UK MPS want make dem Boycott 2022 Winter Olympics for Beijing

translation.en: Calls to boycott the 2022 Winter Olympics have been intensifying steadily due to Chinas alleged human rights abuses, particularly in the Xinjiang region against the Uyghur Muslims.
translation.pcm: Request don dey plenti untop say make pipo boycott di 2022 Winter Olympics, sake of say dem accuse China for human right abuse, especially for di Xinjiang region against di Muslim pipo of Uyghur.

translation.en: The evidence that a genocide is now occurring in western China is so clear, that the UK and the whole world must now stand up to Beijing and use every available tool to stop it, Ed Davey, the leader of the Liberal Democrats, and Labour MP Chris Bryant, a member of the foreign affairs select committee and a former junior foreign minister wrote on the Liberal Democrats website this month.
translation.pcm: Di evidence say genocide don dey happun for western China dey veri clear, sotey di UK and di whole world go need stand up against Beijing and use everi tin wey dey available to stop am.  Ed Davey, di leader of di Liberal Democrats, and Labour MP Chris Bryant, one member of di foreign affairs select committee and one befor-befor junior foreign minister write on top di Liberal Democrats website dis month.

translation.en: We must remember when we failed to stand up against human rights abuses in the past, and recall the images from British sporting history like the England football teams
translation.pcm: We need rememba wen we no gree stand up against human rights abuse for di past, and rememba di image from British sportin history like di England football team,

translation.en: Nazi salutes in the 1930s and the rebel cricket tours to South Africa in the 1980s, Davey said while calling upon the government and the British Olympic Association to act.
translation.pcm: Nazi salute for di 1930s and di rebel cricket tour to South Africa for di 1980s, Davey yarn while e dey call on di government and di British Olympic Association to do somtin.

translation.en: Team GB (Great Brittain), ParalympicsGB and the Government have a moral responsibility to consider if sending a team to these Games
translation.pcm: Team GB (Great Brittain), ParalympicsGB and di Government get moral responsibility to look at, so dem go know if make dem send dia team to dis Game

translation.en: is really the right thing to do.
translation.pcm: na di correct tin to do.

translation.en: The 2022 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games will be used as a propaganda tool for a regime committing genocide, he added.
translation.pcm: Di 2022 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games go be di propaganda tool for dat kind regime wey dey commit genocide, e tok.

translation.en: Recently, Canadas main opposition party, the Conservative Party, urged Prime Minister Justin Trudeau-led government to pressure the International Olympic Committee to move the 2022 Winter Olympics out of Beijing, arguing China is committing genocide against more than one million Uyghurs in Xinjiang.
translation.pcm: Recently, di main opposition party for Canada, di Conservative Party, tell Prime Minister Justin Trudeau government say make dem pressure di International Olympic Committee say make dem carry di 2022 Winter Olympics komot for Beijing, say China dey commit genocide against more dan one million Uyghurs for Xinjiang.

translation.en: This comes after a coalition of 180 human rights groups urged governments around the world to boycott the Beijing Winter Olympic Games slated for next year due to Chinas reported human rights abuses towards minorities.
translation.pcm: Dis na afta 180 join-bodi of human rights group tell governments around di world say make dem boycott di Beijing Winter Olympic Games wey go start next year, sake of say China dey abuse di human right of minorities.

translation.en: The letter calls on countries to refuse participation in the games and to ensure they are not used to embolden the Chinese governments appalling rights abuses and crackdowns on dissent.
translation.pcm: Di letter dey call on kontris say make dem no participate for di games and make dem no allow China use dem kontinue dia wicked abuse of rights and discipline on di minority.

translation.en: The IOC said in a statement that the committees policy for its organising committees is to hear all concerns directly related to the Olympic Games.
translation.pcm: Di IOC tok for one statement say di committee policy for im organisin committee na to hear all di consign wey relate to di Olympic Games.

translation.en: For the Beijing Winter Olympics specifically, the IOC said its Evaluation Committee listened to the views of several NGOs, including concerns about human rights.
translation.pcm: For di Beijing Winter Olympics specifically, di IOC tok say im Evaluation Committee don hear wetin plenti NGO tok, plus dia consign about human rights.

translation.en: The committee cited its position that it shared with groups that IOC must remain neutral on all global political issues although it may not agree with the political structure, social circumstances or human rights standards in its country.
translation.pcm: Di committee tok dia own stand on di mata, say dem agree wit groups say di IOC go need stay neutral on all global politikal issues. Even say e fit no agree wit di politikal structure, social circumstances or human right standard for im kontri.

translation.en: Chinas Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin, on the other hand labelled the calls for boycott as highly irresponsible.
translation.pcm: Howeva, China Foreign Ministry tok-tok pesin Wang Wenbin, tok say di request to boycott di Games dey veri irresponsible.

translation.en: The calls for boycotting next years winter Olympics came after Secretary of State Antony Blinken said he agrees with the former President Donald Trump administrations characterization of the abuse of Uyghurs in China as genocide.
translation.pcm: Di request to boycott next year winter Olympics kom afta Secretary of State, Antony Blinken tok say e agree wit wetin former President Donald Trump administration tok about di abuse of Uyghurs for China as genocide.

translation.en: We are working on post-harvest techs  Provost, Kano Agric College
translation.pcm: We dey work on post-harvest techs -Provost, Kano Agric College

translation.en: Dr Halima Alimi, the Acting Provost, Federal College of Agricultural Produce Technology (FCAPT), Kano, says the institute would develop quality post-harvest technologies for the country.
translation.pcm: Dr Halima Alimi wey be di Acting Provost, Federal College of Agricultural Produce Technology (FCAPT), Kano, tok say di institute go develop quality post-harvest technologies for di kontri.

translation.en: Alimi told newsmen in Kano that the new management of the institution had adopted proactive programmes to encourage research as well as create enabling teaching and learning environment for growth of post-harvest processing.
translation.pcm: Alimi yarn tori-men for Kano say di new management of di institution don adopt proactive programmes to encourage research and create enablin teachin and learnin environment for di growth of post-harvest processin.

translation.en: She said the management was geared to change the narrative through the introduction of new preservation technologies, reduce wastes and boost agricultural processing.
translation.pcm: She tok say di management dey committed to change di narrativethroughdi introduction of new preservation technologies, reduce waste and boost agricultural processin.

translation.en: We will ensure sanity among the staff and students, we shall improve on staff development geared to ensure conducive working and learning environment, she said.
translation.pcm: We go make sure say sanity dey among di staff and students, we go improve on staff development so dem go fit get a conducive workin and learnin environment.

translation.en: According to her, the college offers Ordinary National Diploma (OND) and Higher
translation.pcm: As she yarn, di college dey do Ordinary National Diploma (OND) and Higher

translation.en: National Diploma  (HND) programmes in various fields of agriculture.
translation.pcm: National Diploma  (HND) programme for different aspect of agriculture.

translation.en: Our mandate is on post-harvest science; how to handle agricultural produce after harvest and this includes storage, preservation as well as processing.
translation.pcm: Awa focus na on post-harvest science; how we fit handle agricultural produce afta we don harvest am, and dis include storage, preservation and processin.

translation.en: This is the only school in the country that has this mandate, she said.
translation.pcm: Dis na di only school for di kontri wey get dis mandate, she tok.

translation.en: The provost therefore urged farmers to utilise innovations and other studies being executed by the college to improve their productivity.
translation.pcm: Sake of dis, di provost dey encourage farmers say make dem use di innovations and oda tins wey di college dey do take improve dia productivity.

translation.en: Tuition hike: Police prevent students protest at Kaduna Government House
translation.pcm: Shool Fees Increase: Police prevent protest for Kaduna Government House

translation.en: Police and State Vigilantes Service personnel on Tuesday prevented the protesting students of Kaduna State University from marching towards the Government House.
translation.pcm: Police and State Vigilante Srvice prevent di students of Kaduna State University wey dey protest, on Tuesday say make dem no enta di government house.

translation.en: The students were protesting against the tuition fees increase by the state government.
translation.pcm: Di students dey protest becos of di school fees wey di state government increase.

translation.en: Daily Trust observed that the angry-looking students were singing solidarity songs as they marched towards the government house before they were blocked by the police.
translation.pcm: Daily Trust observe say di angry students dey sing solidarity songs as dem dey march go di government house, befor police kom block dem for road.

translation.en: Heavily armed police personnel in vehicles and vigilantes operating under KADVIS were seen on the main road keeping vigil while the students sat on the floor in the middle of the road.
translation.pcm: Heavily armed police officers for inside vehicle, and vigilantes wey dey operate under KADVIS na im we see for main road dey monitor, while di students siddun ontop floor for di middle of di road.

translation.en: It could be recalled that the state government and management of the university had refused to reverse the fees despite pleas by students and their parents in the state.
translation.pcm: U go rememba say di state government and management of di university don refuse to reverse di money, even say students and parents for di state dey beg.

translation.en: One of the students representatives, Comrade Auba Mohammed, said they were marching towards the government house to just submit a letter of complaint to Governor Nasir El-Rufai.
translation.pcm: One of di student representative, Comrade Auba Mohammed, tok say dem dey march go di government house to just go submit letter of complaint give Governor Nasir El-Rufai.

translation.en: He said the majority of them are orphans and that their parents cannot afford to pay for them.
translation.pcm: E yarn say majority of dem be orphan and dia parents no fit pay for dem.

translation.en: Zimbabwes VP resigns amid sexual misconduct allegations
translation.pcm: Zimbabwea VP don resign untop allegation of sexual misconduct

translation.en: Zimbabwes Vice President, Kembo Mohadi, resigned on Monday in the face of sexual misconduct allegations, apologising for tasks he failed to do well.
translation.pcm: Vice President of Zimbabwe, Kembo Mohadi don resign on Monday untop allegations of sexual misconduct. E tender e apology for di work wey e no do well.

translation.en: Local news outlets have since late last month been awash with audio recordings of phone conversations allegedly of Mohadi soliciting sex from several women, including a subordinate in his office.
translation.pcm: Na since last month local news stations don dey roar wit audio recordings of fone conversation wia Mohadi dey ask different women for sex, one of dem wey be im junior for office.

translation.en: First published by online publication ZimLive, the clips included one where a man can be heard scheduling to meet for sex at his office.
translation.pcm: Di recordings first show for online publication, ZimLive website , Inside di audio, you fit hear wia one man dey book appointment for sex inside im office.

translation.en: I am stepping down as the Vice President of the Republic of Zimbabwe â€¦with immediate effect, the 71-year-old leader said in a letter posted on the information ministrys
translation.pcm: I dey step down as di Vice President of di Republic of Zimbabwe wit immediate effect, di 71-year-old leader tok for inside one letter wey dem post for di ministry of information

translation.en: He had decided to leave office not as a matter of cowardice but out of respect for the office of the presidency so that it is not compromised or caricatured by actions that are linked to my challenges as an individual.
translation.pcm: I don decide to komot for office, no be sake of say I be coward, but unto say I get respect for di office of di presidency, so dem no go fit compromise am, or represent am wit actions wey dey connected to my challenges as a pesin.

translation.en: I have been going through a soul searching pilgrimage and realised that I need the space to deal with my problems outside the governance chair, he said.
translation.pcm: I don dey reflect and tink about mysef, and I see say I need space wey I go take deal wit my problems outside governance. E yarn

translation.en: He repeated his denial of any wrongdoing, saying he was a victim of information distortion, voice cloning, and sponsored spooking and political sabotage.
translation.pcm: E repeat am say im no do any bad tin, say im be victim of information distortion, voice cloning, and sponsored spooking wit political sabotage.

translation.en: Mohadi, a retired soldier and veteran of the countrys liberation war, was one of Zimbabwes two vice presidents.
translation.pcm: Mohadi, wey be retired soldier and foreman of di kontri liberation war, na one of di  two vice presidents for Zimbabwe.

translation.en: He served in several ministerial positions under former president Robert Mugabe and was appointed vice president in 2017 following Mugabes ouster.
translation.pcm: E don serve for different ministerial position under befor-befor president, Robert Mugabe and dem kom appoint am as vice president for 2017 afta dem komot Mugabe.

translation.en: Technologies arm professional farmers in China
translation.pcm: Technology don make professional farmers for China strong.

translation.en: Human resources are of huge importance for Chinas rural vitalization.
translation.pcm: Human resources dey veri important for China rural vitalization.

translation.en: At present, there are over 17 million high-calibre farmers working in the countryside to prosper the rural regions.
translation.pcm: Currently, na more dan 17 million high-class farmers dey work for villages, so dem go fit improve di rural areas.

translation.en: The improved scientific literacy of Chinese farmers has laid a solid foundation for their overall development and is offering stronger support for the countrys rural economy.
translation.pcm: Di knowledge of science wey Chinese farmers get don lay solid foundation for dia general development and e dey give stronger support for di kontri rural economy.

translation.en: Bao Yuan is a young man running an aquatic product company in Qujing, southwest Chinas Yunnan province that he established in 2014 after graduating from Yunnan Normal University in 2014.
translation.pcm: Bao Yuan na young man wey get aquatic product company wey e establish 2014 for Qujing, Yunnan province for southwest China afta e graduate from Yunnan Normal University for 2014.

translation.en: Artificial breeding not only diversifies peoples choices, but also helps protect endangered local fish species, he said.
translation.pcm: E tok say "Artificial breedin no just dey give pipo option of different choice, e also dey protect different kind of fish wey don dey komot for water.

translation.en: Song Xueqin is a Gen Y female who has made her name in the Lvliang Mountains, north Chinas
translation.pcm: Song Xueqin na Gen Y female wey don get name for North China Lvliang Mountains,

translation.en: Shanxi province by flat peach grafting techniques.
translation.pcm: for Shanxi province sake of say she sabi different flat peach graftin technique.

translation.en: After graduation from college, Song was successively engaged in catering business, gypsum processing and sheep husbandry, but didnt succeed in any of those.
translation.pcm: Afta she graduate from college, Song don do different businness like catering, gypsum processin and rearing of sheep, but she no make am for any of dis business.

translation.en: In 2009, she heard that Chinese wild peaches can be turned into flat peaches through grafting techniques, so she asked one of her friends to bring her scions of flat peaches from northwest Chinas Xinjiang Uygur autonomous region and invited an expert to impart relevant skills to her.
translation.pcm: For 2009, she hear say dem fit turn Chinese wild peach to flat peachthroughgraftin, na so she tell one of her friend say make dat one help am bring flat peach scion from di independent Uygur region, Xinjiang province of Northwest China. Afta, she invite one expert say make e kom teach am di tins wey she need to know.

translation.en: A year later, Song and her husband grafted flat peach scions onto over 4,000 wild peaches on a hillside near Hetaozhang village, Fenxi County, Shanxi province, but the fruiting wasnt good.
translation.pcm: Afta 1 year, Song and her husband graft flat peach scions on more dan 4,000 wild peach for one hillside near Hetaozhang village, Fenxi County, for Shanxi province, but di result no good.

translation.en: After consulting relevant materials and experts, we finally realized what cross-pollination was.
translation.pcm: Afta she konsult di relevant materials and experts, she finally realize wetin cross-pollination be.

translation.en: The yield goes high only when varieties grafted match, she said.
translation.pcm: Di yield go only go up wen di type wey dem join togeda match. She yarn.

translation.en: Last year, the woman received her first certification of her life â€“ a certificate for new professional farmers.
translation.pcm: Last year, di woman collect di first certificate for her life, a certificate for new professional farmers.

translation.en: The countryside is never short of resources.
translation.pcm: Rural areas no dey eva lack resources.

translation.en: In recent years, as peoples living standards have been raised, they are developing a larger demand for green and high-quality agricultural products.
translation.pcm: Recently, as pipo standard of living dey high, dem dey get larger demand for fresh and high-quality agricultural products.

translation.en: This trend is mobilizing more and more well-educated entrepreneurs who are technically skilled and know how to operate and manage businesses to go back to the countryside, said Zuo Chenming, a senior researcher with AliResearch, a research arm of Alibaba Group.
translation.pcm: Zuo Chenming wey be senior researcher for  AliResearch, a research branch of Alibaba Group tok say "Dis trend dey make more and more educated entrepreneurs wey get technical skill and know how to do businesses, to go back to di rural area.

translation.en: Early in the morning, Mi Xiaohong from Yuzhong County, Lanzhou, northwest Chinas Gansu province started working in a cowshed, serving the cattle with new fodder and water and cleaning the cowshed.
translation.pcm: For early morning, Mi Xiaohong from Yuzhong County, Lanzhou, Gansu province for Northwest China start work for cowshed, she dey clean di cowshed, and give di cow new feed and water.

translation.en: The making of cattle fodder is complicated, as we must calculate how much grass and other materials we add in it and fairly decide the ratios of bran, glacial flour and salt, she told Peoples Daily, adding that the ingredients have to be adjusted according to different growth periods of the cattle.
translation.pcm: E no easy to make cow feed, becos we need calculate how many grass and oda materials wey we go add for inside. We go need to know di ratio of bran, glacial flour and salt, wey go dey inside. She tell People's Daily, say dem go need dey adjust di ingredients wey dey inside di as di cow dey grow.

translation.en: Mi, always attending training programs held by the county government, has become a specialist in cattle husbandry.
translation.pcm: Mi, dey always go trainin programs wey di County government organise, and she don turn specialist for cattle husbandry.

translation.en: I made many detours as a layman, but now Im often consulted by fellow villagers, she said, adding that only by continuous learning can she solve more problems.
translation.pcm: I divert plenti times wen I still be novice, but now my fellow villagers dey always come meet me for advice. She add am join say, na onlythroughkontinuous learnin she go fit solve more problems.

translation.en: Today, local authorities across China are issuing new policies and measures to encourage farmers to study technologies.
translation.pcm: Today, local authorities all ova China don dey give new policy and technique to make sure say farmers study new technologies.

translation.en: Shandong province has launched a professional title evaluation system for professional farmers, and Jiangsu provinces Kunshan is offering free college education for professional farmers.
translation.pcm: Shandong province don begin one professional title evaluation system for professional farmers, and Jiangsu province Kunshan dey offer free college education for professional farmers.

translation.en: In Gansu Province, training sessions are launched for heads of professional cooperatives and animal epidemic prevention coordinators, in an effort to bring technologies to the farmland and find solutions to agricultural problems.
translation.pcm: For Gansu Province, dem dey organise trainin session for di leaders of professional cooperative and coordinators of animal epidemic prevention. All dis na effort to bring technology to di farm and find solution to agric problems.

translation.en: 2023: Group launches #BringBackGEJ project, pledges to fund campaigns
translation.pcm: 2023: Group Begin #BringBackGEJ project, pledge to fund campaign

translation.en: A group under the aegis of Youths Earnestly Demand For
translation.pcm: A group under di sponsorship of Youths Earnestly Demand For

translation.en: Goodluck E.Jonathan (YED4GEJ 2023) has asked former President Goodluck Jonathan to contest the 2023 presidential election.
translation.pcm: Goodluck E.Jonathan (YED4GEJ 2023) don tell former President Goodluck Jonathan say make e contest for di 2023 presidential election.

translation.en: Jonathan lost power to the candidate of the then opposition All Progressives Congress (APC), Gen. Muhammadu Buhari (rtd) in the 2015 general election, thus, putting an end to the 16 years of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) reign in the country.
translation.pcm: Jonathan wey lose power to di candidate of befor-befor opposition party, All Progressives Congress (APC), Gen. Muhammadu Buhari (rtd) for di 2015 general election. Dis na im end di 16 years wey People's Democratic Party (PDP) don dey rulefor di kontri.

translation.en: National Chairman of the group, Prince Teddy Omiloli and National Director Operations, Comrade Douye Daniel in a statement on Sunday expressed optimism that Jonathan would tackle the challenges bedeviling the country if given the mandate.
translation.pcm: Di National Chairman of di group, Prince Teddy Omiloli and National Director Operations, Comrade Douye Daniel tok on Sunday for inside one statement say, dem get hope say Jonathan go tackle di challenges wey torment di kontri if dem give am di power.

translation.en: The group explained that Jonathan saw the need to restructure Nigeria while in power and called for a national confab in 2014, but was not allowed to implement it, as he was voted out of office, hence the need to give him another chance.
translation.pcm: Di group explain say Jonathan don see di reason why we need to restructure Nigeria wen e dey power, and na why e organise national confab for 2014, but dem no allow am implement am, sake of say dem komot am for office. Na why we need give am anoda chance.

translation.en: At this point in time, after a vivid look into the ideologies and activities of our present political players which includes the youths and elders, we saw in Goodluck Jonathan, a true democrat, a nation builder, a divine inspired goal oriented leader of integrity that has the solution to the present Nigeria problems.
translation.pcm: Right now, wen we check di ideology and activity of awa present politicians, di youth and elders join togeda, we see say Goodluck Jonathan wey be true democrat, nation builder, and leader of integrity wey get beta goal na im get di solution to di problem wey dey face Nigeria presently.

translation.en: He (Jonathan) has proven that he can sacrifice anything to ensure the unity, peace and development of our great nation Nigeria.
translation.pcm: E (Jonathan) don prove say e fit sacrifice anytin to ensure di unity, peace and development of awa great nation Nigeria.

translation.en: We, as youths of this great nation after discovering the Nigeria problems and found the solution in Goodluck Jonathan, we are calling on all Nigerians including our political elites, present administration and religious leaders to join the call for the return of Goodluck Ebele Jonathan and also join our #BringbackGEJ project.
translation.pcm: We, as youths of dis great nation, afta we don discover Nigeria problem, and we don see say Goodluck Jonathan na di solution, we dey call on all Nigerians, plus awa politikal elites, present administration and religious leaders say make dem join di call for Goodluck Ebele Jonathan to kom back and make dem also join awa #BringbackGEJ project.

translation.en: We the youths are ready to purchase President Jonathans form in any party he chooses to flag from and we will fund his electioneering campaign from the beginning to end the moment he accepts this divine call, the group said.
translation.pcm: We di youths dey ready to buy President Jonathan form for any party wey e choose to contest from, and we go fund im campaign from di beginnin to di end, once e don accept dis divine call. Di group tok.

translation.en: Rice sufficiency: Nigeria has a long way to go Expert
translation.pcm: Rice sufficiency: Nigeria get long way to go Expert

translation.en: Dr Philip Idinoba, a rice commodity specialist with AfricaRice, has raised concerns over increasing population that is eroding Federal Governments effort toward boosting rice production.
translation.pcm: Dr Philip Idinoba, wey be rice commodity specialist for AfricaRice, don show im consign untop di increasin population wey dey affect Federal Government effort to boost rice production.

translation.en: Idinoba expressed the concern in an interview with the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) in Gombe on Tuesday.
translation.pcm: Idinoba yarn dis one for interview wit News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) for Gombe on Tuesday.

translation.en: He said that there is need for more government investment on rice to boost Nigerias food security.
translation.pcm: E tok say government need to invest more on rice, so e go fit boost Nigeria food security.

translation.en: According to him, the government is doing a lot to boost rice production, being a staple food, but the growing population of the country is eroding such gains.
translation.pcm: As e yarn, di government dey do plenti tins to boost rice production, sake of say na staple food, but di growin population of di kontri dey bring down di effort.

translation.en: He said that the rate of urbanisation, which is one of the key drivers of rice consumption in Nigeria, was far higher than the rate at which rice cultivation was being improved.
translation.pcm: E tok say di rate of urbanisation, wey be one of di key factors of rice consumption for Nigeria, dey veri high pass di rate wey we take dey use plant rice.

translation.en: Nigeria still has a long way to go in terms of rice sufficiency.
translation.pcm: Nigeria still get long way to go for rice sufficiency.

translation.en: We are making efforts every year through the Anchor Borrowers Programme, special intervention programme and other donor funded projects.
translation.pcm: We dey make effort everi yearthroughdi Anchor Borrowers Programme, special intervention programme and oda donor funded projects.

translation.en: These are to bring certain things that will help farmers increase yields and productivity.
translation.pcm: All dis na to bring som tins wey go help farmers increase dia yield and productivity.

translation.en: But in spite of these Federal Government efforts, the number of new mouths we are adding yearly writes off all these improvements, Idinoba said.
translation.pcm: But even wit all dis Federal Government effort, di numba of new mouth wey dey join evri year cancel all dis improvement. Idinoba yarn.

translation.en: A lot to be done
translation.pcm: Plenti tins to do

translation.en: The agronomist added that a lot needed to be done through increased investments, especially in dry season farming.
translation.pcm: Di agronomist add am join say we need to do plenti tins by increasin awa investment, especially for dry season farmin.

translation.en: Dry season farming, according to him, can be leveraged on to boost rice productivity.
translation.pcm: As Idinoba tok, we fit take advantage of dry season farmin to boost rice productivity.

translation.en: We will have better result in rice production if we will be able to close the gaps that dry season often writes off in rice cultivation.
translation.pcm: We go get beta result for rice production if we fit close di gaps wey dry season dey always cancel for rice cultivation.

translation.en: According to him, if you have eight million farmers cultivating rice in the wet season and only two million of them cultivate rice in the dry season, then the efforts are not enough yet.
translation.pcm: E yarn say, if u get eight million farmers wey dey plant rice for wet season, and only two million out of dem dey plant rice for dry season, den di effort never reach yet.

translation.en: Idinoba, who is also a water management specialist, advised farmers in flood-prone areas in the country to plant flood-tolerant varieties that could survive in water between three and four weeks.
translation.pcm: Idinoba, wey still be water management specialist, advise farmers wey dey areas wit flood for di kontri say make dem plant di kind seed wey go fit tolerate flood and go fit survive for water between three to four weeks.

translation.en: These varieties, which were released three years ago and being multiplied by the National Seeds Council of Nigeria and other seeds companies, he said, were available and could be accessed by farmers.
translation.pcm: He tok am say All dis varieties, wey dem release three years ago, and still dey multiply by di National Seeds Council of Nigeria, wit oda seeds companies, dey available, and farmers go fit get am.

translation.en: This year, the kind of stories we heard from farmers in Kebbi, Jigawa and Adamawa, with this kind of varieties, you may not have total failure like that.
translation.pcm: Dis year, wit di kind tori wey we hear from farmers for Kebbi, Jigawa and Adamawa wey use dis kind varieties, u fit no get complete failure laidat.

translation.en: Hence, integrating such technologies will help in a way.
translation.pcm: Derefor, make we combine dis kind technology go help one way.

translation.en: The rice specialist added that in such areas, there should be improvement in the cropping environment through the construction of water structures to control, retain or evacuate water.
translation.pcm: Di rice specialist add am say for dose kind areas, improvement go need dey di cropping environmentthroughdi construction of water structures to kontrol, retain or evacuate water.

translation.en: Volleyball: JVC Bauchi eye Premier League ticket
translation.pcm: Volleyball: JVC Bauchi get eye for Premier League ticket

translation.en: The Coach JVC volleyball club of Bauchi, Monday Dada has said his team is eager to gain promotion to the Nigerian Premier League.
translation.pcm: Monday Dada wey be di Coach JVC volleyball club of Bauchi, don yarn say im team dey eager to collect promotion enta di Nigerian Premier League.

translation.en: The coach made this known Wednesday after his side defeated Oyo State 3-1 (25-23, 25-21, 28-30, 25-22) at the ongoing 2021 National Division 1 Volleyball League in Kaduna.
translation.pcm: Di coach yarn dis one on Wednesday afta im side beat Oyo State 3-1 (25-23, 25-21, 28-30, 25-22) for di ongoin 2021 National Division 1 Volleyball League for Kaduna.

translation.en: He said based on the calibre of players in the team, JVC of Bauchi belongs to the Premier League class.
translation.pcm: E tok say base on di kind players wey dey di team, JVC of Bauchi belong to di Premier League class.

translation.en: JVC of Bauchi is in the Division 1 league to gain promotion to next seasons premier league because that is where the big guns are and that is what we are aiming for.
translation.pcm: JVC of Bauchi dey di Division 1 league, and dem go collect promotion enta next season premier league, unto say na dere di big guns dey, and na wetin we dey aim for be dat.

translation.en: We do not expect anything apart from getting the ticket, he said.
translation.pcm: We no dey expect anytin more dan to get di ticket, e yarn.

translation.en: Dada also took responsibility for the failure of his team to beat Kwara State on Tuesday as he said it was due to his technical mistakes.
translation.pcm: Dada sef take responsibility for di failure of im team to beat Kwara State on Tuesday. E explain say na becos of im own technical mistakes.

translation.en: In other matches played yesterday, Spartans Spikers of Yola lost 2-3 (21-25, 22-25, 25-17, 25-21, 12-15) to Kwara United, Katsina United spanked Caliphate Spikers of Sokoto 3-1 (25-23, 25-19, 22-25, 25-12) while Kada Kings thrashed Equity Spikers of Kebbi 3-0 (25-14, 25-15, 25-14).
translation.pcm: For oda match wey dem play yestaday, Spartans Spikers of Yola lose 2-3 (21-25, 22-25, 25-17, 25-21, 12-15) to Kwara United, Katsina United flog Caliphate Spikers of Sokoto 3-1 (25-23, 25-19, 22-25, 25-12) while Kada Kings scatter Equity Spikers of Kebbi 3-0 (25-14, 25-15, 25-14).

translation.en: What Kano needs in 2023
translation.pcm: Wetin Kano need for 2023

translation.en: Kano needs to chart a new path to development in 2023.
translation.pcm: Kano need create new path to development for 2023.

translation.en: This is because the state is sliding into the pit of poverty.
translation.pcm: Dis na becos di state don dey enta di pit of poverty.

translation.en: Our rich pre-colonial history indicates that Kano was the richest of all Hausa states because of state involvement in the economy.
translation.pcm: Awa rich pre-colonial history show say na Kano rich pass for all di Hausa states, becos di state dey involve for di economy.

translation.en: Although, the colonialists destroyed the economic foundation of Kano and other colonised societies the policies of those who led the Native Authority from 1926 to 1963 contributed to maintaining Kano as the leading economic centre of Northern Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Even say di colonialists destroy di economic foundation of Kano and oda society wey dem colonise, di policy of di pipo wey lead di Native Authority from 1926 to 1963 contribute to make Kano remain as di leadin economic centre of Northern Nigeria.

translation.en: For example, they established the first modern water treatment plant in the region in 1931, the first independent power plant in Northern Nigeria of 15mw and for over 80 years, no similar one has been established in Northern Nigeria.
translation.pcm: For example, dem establish di first modern water treatment plant wey dey di region for 1931, di first independent power plant for Northern Nigeria, wey get 15MW, and for more dan 80 years, dem neva establish any one wey resemble am for Northern Nigeria.

translation.en: They established the first industrial estate in the Northern Region, they inherited one primary school in 1926 and by 1963 every village had a primary school (hundreds), they established secondary schools, they inherited no hospital (but one dispensary) and by 1963 there were two general hospitals and hundreds of dispensaries in every village headed by Dagachi had one.
translation.pcm: Dem establish di first industrial estate wey dey di Northern Region, dem inherit only one primary school for 1926, and for 1963 everi village don get primary school (more dan hundred), dem establish secondary schools, dem no meet any hospital (except one dispensary) and for 1963 dem don build two general hospital and more dan hundred dispensaries for everi village.

translation.en: They laid the foundation of modern Kano.
translation.pcm: Na dem lay di foundation of modern Kano.

translation.en: Politically, they made the NPC to become the ruling party of Nigeria.
translation.pcm: Politikally, na dem make di NPC becom di rulin party for Nigeria.

translation.en: From 1966 to 1979 and 1984 to 1999, Kano still maintained its position as second to Lagos.
translation.pcm: From 1966 to 1979 and 1984 to 1999, Kano still maintain im position as di second to Lagos.

translation.en: Kano does not have control over macro-economic policies but its leaders can provide the enabling environment for economic growth.
translation.pcm: Kano no get kontrol ova macro-economic policy but e leaders fit provide di right environment for economic growth.

translation.en: For example, the Dawanau Market, which is the largest grains market in West Africa bringing people from all parts of the continent from as far as Gabon and Congo.
translation.pcm: For example, di Dawanau Market, wey still be di biggest grain market for West Africa, e dey bring pipo from all part of di kontinent, even from far place like Gabon and Congo.

translation.en: This was all as a result of the foresight of Alhaji Bashari Garko (may Allah bless his soul), who established the market.
translation.pcm: All dis na result of di foresight wey Alhaji Bashari Garko (may Allah bless im soul), wey establish di market get.

translation.en: The three administrations that governed Kano from 1999 to date, could all claim that each one of them was the best thing that has happened to Kano but why has Kano degenerated to number nine in Nigeria?
translation.pcm: Di three administration wey don rule Kano from 1999 till today, fit claim say all of dem be di best tin wey don happun to Kano, but why Kano don reduce to numba nine for Nigeria?

translation.en: There is no single project that has brought any significant economic change in Kano despite several efforts by concerned individuals.
translation.pcm: One single project no dey wey don bring correct economic change for Kano, even afta plenti effort of consign pipo.

translation.en: If there is elite focus and determination, with state leadership as it was in the pre-colonial period, Kano would not have gone down to number nine in Nigeria with a GDP of $13.30b after Lagos ($46.03b), Rivers ($32.14b), Delta ($25.48b), Oyo ($21.64b), Imo ($20.64), Edo ($17.50b), Akwa Ibom ($15.26) and Ogun ($13.82).
translation.pcm: If di elite dey focus and determine, wit state leadership as e dey for di pre-colonial period, Kano no go go down to numba nine for Nigeria wit GDP of $13.30b afta Lagos ($46.03b), Rivers ($32.14b), Delta ($25.48b), Oyo ($21.64b), Imo ($20.64), Edo ($17.50b), Akwa Ibom ($15.26) and Ogun ($13.82).

translation.en: The catastrophe in the next 10 years if not averted now, will be beyond our imagination.
translation.pcm: If we no prevent am now, we no go fit imagine di disaster wey go kom in di next 10 years.

translation.en: This is because of many reasons, one of which is we have over four million pupils in public basic schools (primary and JSS) and by 2033 they would have completed secondary education.
translation.pcm: Dis na becos of many reasons. One of dem be say we get more dan four million pupils for public basic schools (primary and JSS) and by 2033 dem go don finish secondary education.

translation.en: Assuming only 10 percent of them (400,000) will proceed to higher-level can the government fund their education?
translation.pcm: Assume say na onli 10 percent of dem (400,000) go go higher-level, di government go fit sponsor dia education?

translation.en: After completing higher education, can the economy absorb them with gainful employment?
translation.pcm: Afta dem complete higher education, di economy go fit give dem beta employment?

translation.en: At the current state of development, it cannot.
translation.pcm: As e be so, e no fit.

translation.en: This is because, there are over 250 medical doctors and over 1000 nurses sponsored by the state government, who could not be absorbed despite the need.
translation.pcm: Dis na becos, more dan 250 medical doctors and more dan 1000 nurses wey di state government dey sponsor, na im dem no fit employ.

translation.en: We keep deceiving ourselves with so-called skills acquisition programmes that train artisans who will not get any job after acquiring the skills because the local economy cannot absorb them.
translation.pcm: We go dey deceive awasef wit di skills acquisition programme wey dey train artisans wey no go get any job afta dem learn di skills, sake of say di local economy no fit employ dem.

translation.en: Every day we hear billions allocated by the federal government for one economic programme or the other and yet our ideas are never beyond training plumbers, carpenters, mechanics etc.
translation.pcm: Everi day we dey hear billions wey federal government allocate for one economic programme or di oda, and still, we no dey reason pass to train plumbers, carpenters, mechanics etc.

translation.en: Our ideas, so far, are not about harnessing resources for the employment of a larger population as Gajimasu (1095-1135) did when he started the city walls.
translation.pcm: Since, awa idea no dey about how we go use resources employ di large population as Gajimasu (1095-1135) do wen e begin di city walls.

translation.en: We have to think out of the box.
translation.pcm: We need tink outside di box.

translation.en: Kano does not need a superhuman being with the best qualifications and experience or a saint as the next governor.
translation.pcm: Kano no need genius wey get di best qualification and experience, or saint as di next governor.

translation.en: This is because the governors in the last 20 years possessed some of the best qualities and might have even done their best but as we can all see, the outcome has not been the best for the state.
translation.pcm: Dis na becos di governors wey dey for di last 20 years get som of di best quality, and dem fit even don do dia best, but as all of us dey see, di result no be di best for di state.

translation.en: Therefore, we must think out of the box.
translation.pcm: So, we need reason outside di box.

translation.en: The two parties APC and PDP cannot provide the desired leadership because they are controlled by godfathers, not ideologically driven, but mainly concerned with sharing of state resources.
translation.pcm: Di two parties, APC and PDP no fit provide di kind leadership wey we want, sake of say na godfathers dey kontrol dem, and dem no get idea on wetin to do, but dia main focus na how to share di state resources.

translation.en: The best they can offer is to negotiate for a governor who will serve the interest of a godfather or a clique.
